text_he: ויתחתן שלמה את-פרעה מלך מצרים ויקח את-בת-פרעה ויביאה אל-עיר דוד עד כלתו לבנות את-ביתו ואת-בית יהוה ואת-חומת ירושלם סביב | And Solomon became allied to Pharaoh king of Egypt by marriage and took Pharaoh's daughter and brought her into the city of David until he had made an end of building his own house and the house of the LORD and the wall of Jerusalem round about | ויהורם בן-אחאב מלך על-ישראל בשמרון בשנת שמנה עשרה ליהושפט מלך יהודה וימלך שתים-עשרה שנה | Now Jehoram the son of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria in the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah and reigned twelve years
text_en: And Solomon became allied to Pharaoh king of Egypt by marriage, and took Pharaoh's daughter, and brought her into the city of David, until he had made an end of building his own house, and the house of the LORD, and the wall of Jerusalem round about.
text_pisuk: וַיִּתְחַתֵּן שְׁלֹמֹה, אֶת-פַּרְעֹה מֶלֶךְ מִצְרָיִם; וַיִּקַּח אֶת-בַּת-פַּרְעֹה, וַיְבִיאֶהָ אֶל-עִיר דָּוִד, עַד כַּלֹּתוֹ לִבְנוֹת אֶת-בֵּיתוֹ וְאֶת-בֵּית יְהוָה, וְאֶת-חוֹמַת יְרוּשָׁלִַם סָבִיב. | And Solomon became allied to Pharaoh king of Egypt by marriage, and took Pharaoh's daughter, and brought her into the city of David, until he had made an end of building his own house, and the house of the LORD, and the wall of Jerusalem round about. | וִיהוֹרָם בֶּן-אַחְאָב, מָלַךְ עַל-יִשְׂרָאֵל בְּשֹׁמְרוֹן, בִּשְׁנַת שְׁמֹנֶה עֶשְׂרֵה, לִיהוֹשָׁפָט מֶלֶךְ יְהוּדָה; וַיִּמְלֹךְ, שְׁתֵּים-עֶשְׂרֵה שָׁנָה. | Now Jehoram the son of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria in the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, and reigned twelve years.

text_he: רק העם מזבחים במות כי לא-נבנה בית לשם יהוה עד הימים הם | Only the people sacrificed in the high places because there was no house built for the name of the LORD until those days | ויעשה הרע בעיני יהוה--רק לא כאביו וכאמו ויסר את-מצבת הבעל אשר עשה אביו | And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD but not like his father and like his mother for he put away the pillar of Baal that his father had made
text_en: Only the people sacrificed in the high places, because there was no house built for the name of the LORD until those days.
text_pisuk: רַק הָעָם, מְזַבְּחִים בַּבָּמוֹת: כִּי לֹא-נִבְנָה בַיִת לְשֵׁם יְהוָה, עַד הַיָּמִים הָהֵם. | Only the people sacrificed in the high places, because there was no house built for the name of the LORD until those days. | וַיַּעֲשֶׂה הָרַע, בְּעֵינֵי יְהוָה--רַק, לֹא כְאָבִיו וּכְאִמּוֹ; וַיָּסַר אֶת-מַצְּבַת הַבַּעַל, אֲשֶׁר עָשָׂה אָבִיו. | And he did that which was evil in the sight of the LORD; but not like his father, and like his mother; for he put away the pillar of Baal that his father had made.

text_he: ויאהב שלמה את-יהוה לכת בחקות דוד אביו רק במות--הוא מזבח ומקטיר | And Solomon loved the LORD walking in the statutes of David his father only he sacrificed and offered in the high places | רק בחטאות ירבעם בן-נבט אשר-החטיא את-ישראל--דבק לא-סר מנה | Nevertheless he cleaved unto the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat wherewith he made Israel to sin he departed not therefrom
text_en: And Solomon loved the LORD, walking in the statutes of David his father; only he sacrificed and offered in the high places.
text_pisuk: וַיֶּאֱהַב שְׁלֹמֹה, אֶת-יְהוָה, לָלֶכֶת, בְּחֻקּוֹת דָּוִד אָבִיו: רַק, בַּבָּמוֹת--הוּא מְזַבֵּחַ, וּמַקְטִיר. | And Solomon loved the LORD, walking in the statutes of David his father; only he sacrificed and offered in the high places. | רַק בְּחַטֹּאות יָרָבְעָם בֶּן-נְבָט, אֲשֶׁר-הֶחֱטִיא אֶת-יִשְׂרָאֵל--דָּבֵק: לֹא-סָר, מִמֶּנָּה. | Nevertheless he cleaved unto the sins of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, wherewith he made Israel to sin; he departed not therefrom.

text_he: וילך המלך גבענה לזבח שם כי-היא הבמה הגדולה אלף עלות יעלה שלמה על המזבח הוא | And the king went to Gibeon to sacrifice there for that was the great high place a thousand burnt-offerings did Solomon offer upon that altar | ומישע מלך-מואב היה נקד והשיב למלך-ישראל מאה-אלף כרים ומאה אלף אילים צמר | Now Mesha king of Moab was a sheep-master and he rendered unto the king of Israel the wool of a hundred thousand lambs and of a hundred thousand rams
text_en: And the king went to Gibeon to sacrifice there; for that was the great high place; a thousand burnt-offerings did Solomon offer upon that altar.
text_pisuk: וַיֵּלֶךְ הַמֶּלֶךְ גִּבְעֹנָה לִזְבֹּחַ שָׁם, כִּי-הִיא הַבָּמָה הַגְּדוֹלָה; אֶלֶף עֹלוֹת יַעֲלֶה שְׁלֹמֹה, עַל הַמִּזְבֵּחַ הַהוּא. | And the king went to Gibeon to sacrifice there; for that was the great high place; a thousand burnt-offerings did Solomon offer upon that altar. | וּמֵישַׁע מֶלֶךְ-מוֹאָב, הָיָה נֹקֵד; וְהֵשִׁיב לְמֶלֶךְ-יִשְׂרָאֵל מֵאָה-אֶלֶף כָּרִים, וּמֵאָה אֶלֶף אֵילִים צָמֶר. | Now Mesha king of Moab was a sheep-master; and he rendered unto the king of Israel the wool of a hundred thousand lambs, and of a hundred thousand rams.

text_he: בגבעון נראה יהוה אל-שלמה--בחלום הלילה ויאמר אלהים שאל מה אתן-לך | In Gibeon the LORD appeared to Solomon in a dream by night and God said 'Ask what I shall give thee' | ויהי כמות אחאב ויפשע מלך-מואב במלך ישראל | But it came to pass when Ahab was dead that the king of Moab rebelled against the king of Israel
text_en: In Gibeon the LORD appeared to Solomon in a dream by night; and God said: 'Ask what I shall give thee.'
text_pisuk: בְּגִבְעוֹן, נִרְאָה יְהוָה אֶל-שְׁלֹמֹה--בַּחֲלוֹם הַלָּיְלָה; וַיֹּאמֶר אֱלֹהִים, שְׁאַל מָה אֶתֶּן-לָךְ. | In Gibeon the LORD appeared to Solomon in a dream by night; and God said: 'Ask what I shall give thee.' | וַיְהִי, כְּמוֹת אַחְאָב; וַיִּפְשַׁע מֶלֶךְ-מוֹאָב, בְּמֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל. | But it came to pass, when Ahab was dead, that the king of Moab rebelled against the king of Israel.

text_he: ויאמר שלמה אתה עשית עם-עבדך דוד אבי חסד גדול כאשר הלך לפניך באמת ובצדקה ובישרת לב עמך ותשמר-לו את-החסד הגדול הזה ותן-לו בן ישב על-כסאו כיום הזה | And Solomon said 'Thou hast shown unto Thy servant David my father great kindness according as he walked before Thee in truth and in righteousness and in uprightness of heart with Thee and Thou hast kept for him this great kindness that Thou hast given him a son to sit on his throne as it is this day | ויצא המלך יהורם ביום הוא--משמרון ויפקד את-כל-ישראל | And king Jehoram went out of Samaria at that time and mustered all Israel
text_en: And Solomon said: 'Thou hast shown unto Thy servant David my father great kindness, according as he walked before Thee in truth, and in righteousness, and in uprightness of heart with Thee; and Thou hast kept for him this great kindness, that Thou hast given him a son to sit on his throne, as it is this day.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר שְׁלֹמֹה, אַתָּה עָשִׂיתָ עִם-עַבְדְּךָ דָוִד אָבִי חֶסֶד גָּדוֹל, כַּאֲשֶׁר הָלַךְ לְפָנֶיךָ בֶּאֱמֶת וּבִצְדָקָה וּבְיִשְׁרַת לֵבָב, עִמָּךְ; וַתִּשְׁמָר-לוֹ, אֶת-הַחֶסֶד הַגָּדוֹל הַזֶּה, וַתִּתֶּן-לוֹ בֵן יֹשֵׁב עַל-כִּסְאוֹ, כַּיּוֹם הַזֶּה. | And Solomon said: 'Thou hast shown unto Thy servant David my father great kindness, according as he walked before Thee in truth, and in righteousness, and in uprightness of heart with Thee; and Thou hast kept for him this great kindness, that Thou hast given him a son to sit on his throne, as it is this day. | וַיֵּצֵא הַמֶּלֶךְ יְהוֹרָם, בַּיּוֹם הַהוּא--מִשֹּׁמְרוֹן; וַיִּפְקֹד, אֶת-כָּל-יִשְׂרָאֵל. | And king Jehoram went out of Samaria at that time, and mustered all Israel.

text_he: ועתה יהוה אלהי אתה המלכת את-עבדך תחת דוד אבי ואנכי נער קטן לא אדע צאת ובא | And now O LORD my God Thou hast made Thy servant king instead of David my father and I am but a little child I know not how to go out or come in | וילך וישלח אל-יהושפט מלך-יהודה לאמר מלך מואב פשע בי--התלך אתי אל-מואב למלחמה ויאמר אעלה כמוני כמוך כעמי כעמך כסוסי כסוסיך | And he went and sent to Jehoshaphat the king of Judah saying 'The king of Moab hath rebelled against me wilt thou go with me against Moab to battle' And he said 'I will go up I am as thou art my people as thy people my horses as thy horses'
text_en: And now, O LORD my God, Thou hast made Thy servant king instead of David my father; and I am but a little child; I know not how to go out or come in.
text_pisuk: וְעַתָּה, יְהוָה אֱלֹהָי, אַתָּה הִמְלַכְתָּ אֶת-עַבְדְּךָ, תַּחַת דָּוִד אָבִי; וְאָנֹכִי נַעַר קָטֹן, לֹא אֵדַע צֵאת וָבֹא. | And now, O LORD my God, Thou hast made Thy servant king instead of David my father; and I am but a little child; I know not how to go out or come in. | וַיֵּלֶךְ וַיִּשְׁלַח אֶל-יְהוֹשָׁפָט מֶלֶךְ-יְהוּדָה לֵאמֹר, מֶלֶךְ מוֹאָב פָּשַׁע בִּי--הֲתֵלֵךְ אִתִּי אֶל-מוֹאָב, לַמִּלְחָמָה; וַיֹּאמֶר אֶעֱלֶה, כָּמוֹנִי כָמוֹךָ כְּעַמִּי כְעַמֶּךָ כְּסוּסַי כְּסוּסֶיךָ. | And he went and sent to Jehoshaphat the king of Judah, saying: 'The king of Moab hath rebelled against me; wilt thou go with me against Moab to battle?' And he said: 'I will go up; I am as thou art, my people as thy people, my horses as thy horses.'

text_he: ועבדך--בתוך עמך אשר בחרת עם-רב אשר לא-ימנה ולא יספר מרב | And Thy servant is in the midst of Thy people which Thou hast chosen a great people that cannot be numbered nor counted for multitude | ויאמר אי-זה הדרך נעלה ויאמר דרך מדבר אדום | And he said 'Which way shall we go up' And he answered 'The way of the wilderness of Edom'
text_en: And Thy servant is in the midst of Thy people which Thou hast chosen, a great people, that cannot be numbered nor counted for multitude.
text_pisuk: וְעַבְדְּךָ--בְּתוֹךְ עַמְּךָ, אֲשֶׁר בָּחָרְתָּ: עַם-רָב, אֲשֶׁר לֹא-יִמָּנֶה וְלֹא יִסָּפֵר מֵרֹב. | And Thy servant is in the midst of Thy people which Thou hast chosen, a great people, that cannot be numbered nor counted for multitude. | וַיֹּאמֶר, אֵי-זֶה הַדֶּרֶךְ נַעֲלֶה; וַיֹּאמֶר, דֶּרֶךְ מִדְבַּר אֱדוֹם. | And he said: 'Which way shall we go up?' And he answered: 'The way of the wilderness of Edom.'

text_he: ונת לעבדך לב שמע לשפט את-עמך להבין בין-טוב לרע כי מי יוכל לשפט את-עמך הכבד הזה | Give Thy servant therefore an understanding heart to judge Thy people that I may discern between good and evil for who is able to judge this Thy great people' | וילך מלך ישראל ומלך-יהודה ומלך אדום ויסבו דרך שבעת ימים ולא-היה מים למחנה ולבהמה אשר ברגליהם | So the king of Israel went and the king of Judah and the king of Edom and they made a circuit of seven days' journey and there was no water for the host nor for the beasts that followed them
text_en: Give Thy servant therefore an understanding heart to judge Thy people, that I may discern between good and evil; for who is able to judge this Thy great people?'
text_pisuk: וְנָתַתָּ לְעַבְדְּךָ לֵב שֹׁמֵעַ, לִשְׁפֹּט אֶת-עַמְּךָ, לְהָבִין, בֵּין-טוֹב לְרָע: כִּי מִי יוּכַל לִשְׁפֹּט, אֶת-עַמְּךָ הַכָּבֵד הַזֶּה. | Give Thy servant therefore an understanding heart to judge Thy people, that I may discern between good and evil; for who is able to judge this Thy great people?' | וַיֵּלֶךְ מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל וּמֶלֶךְ-יְהוּדָה, וּמֶלֶךְ אֱדוֹם, וַיָּסֹבּוּ, דֶּרֶךְ שִׁבְעַת יָמִים; וְלֹא-הָיָה מַיִם לַמַּחֲנֶה וְלַבְּהֵמָה, אֲשֶׁר בְּרַגְלֵיהֶם. | So the king of Israel went, and the king of Judah, and the king of Edom; and they made a circuit of seven days' journey; and there was no water for the host, nor for the beasts that followed them.

text_he: ויטב הדבר בעיני אדני כי שאל שלמה את-הדבר הזה | And the speech pleased the LORD that Solomon had asked this thing | ויאמר מלך ישראל אה--כי-קרא יהוה לשלשת המלכים האלה לת אותם ביד-מואב | And the king of Israel said 'Alas for the LORD hath called these three kings together to deliver them into the hand of Moab'{S}
text_en: And the speech pleased the LORD, that Solomon had asked this thing.
text_pisuk: וַיִּיטַב הַדָּבָר, בְּעֵינֵי אֲדֹנָי: כִּי שָׁאַל שְׁלֹמֹה, אֶת-הַדָּבָר הַזֶּה. | And the speech pleased the LORD, that Solomon had asked this thing. | וַיֹּאמֶר, מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל: אֲהָהּ--כִּי-קָרָא יְהוָה לִשְׁלֹשֶׁת הַמְּלָכִים הָאֵלֶּה, לָתֵת אוֹתָם בְּיַד-מוֹאָב. | And the king of Israel said: 'Alas! for the LORD hath called these three kings together to deliver them into the hand of Moab.'{S}

text_he: ויאמר אלהים אליו יען אשר שאלת את-הדבר הזה ולא-שאלת לך ימים רבים ולא-שאלת לך עשר ולא שאלת נפש איביך ושאלת לך הבין לשמע משפט | And God said unto him 'Because thou hast asked this thing and hast not asked for thyself long life neither hast asked riches for thyself nor hast asked the life of thine enemies but hast asked for thyself understanding to discern justice | ויאמר יהושפט האין פה נביא ליהוה ונדרשה את-יהוה מאותו ויען אחד מעבדי מלך-ישראל ויאמר פה אלישע בן-שפט אשר-יצק מים על-ידי אליהו | But Jehoshaphat said 'Is there not here a prophet of the LORD that we may inquire of the LORD by him' And one of the king of Israel's servants answered and said 'Elisha the son of Shaphat is here who poured water on the hands of Elijah'
text_en: And God said unto him: 'Because thou hast asked this thing, and hast not asked for thyself long life; neither hast asked riches for thyself, nor hast asked the life of thine enemies; but hast asked for thyself understanding to discern justice;
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר אֱלֹהִים אֵלָיו, יַעַן אֲשֶׁר שָׁאַלְתָּ אֶת-הַדָּבָר הַזֶּה וְלֹא-שָׁאַלְתָּ לְּךָ יָמִים רַבִּים וְלֹא-שָׁאַלְתָּ לְּךָ עֹשֶׁר, וְלֹא שָׁאַלְתָּ, נֶפֶשׁ אֹיְבֶיךָ; וְשָׁאַלְתָּ לְּךָ הָבִין, לִשְׁמֹעַ מִשְׁפָּט. | And God said unto him: 'Because thou hast asked this thing, and hast not asked for thyself long life; neither hast asked riches for thyself, nor hast asked the life of thine enemies; but hast asked for thyself understanding to discern justice; | וַיֹּאמֶר יְהוֹשָׁפָט, הַאֵין פֹּה נָבִיא לַיהוָה, וְנִדְרְשָׁה אֶת-יְהוָה, מֵאוֹתוֹ; וַיַּעַן אֶחָד מֵעַבְדֵי מֶלֶךְ-יִשְׂרָאֵל, וַיֹּאמֶר, פֹּה אֱלִישָׁע בֶּן-שָׁפָט, אֲשֶׁר-יָצַק מַיִם עַל-יְדֵי אֵלִיָּהוּ. | But Jehoshaphat said: 'Is there not here a prophet of the LORD, that we may inquire of the LORD by him?' And one of the king of Israel's servants answered and said: 'Elisha the son of Shaphat is here, who poured water on the hands of Elijah.'

text_he: הנה עשיתי כדבריך הנה נתי לך לב חכם ונבון אשר כמוך לא-היה לפניך ואחריך לא-יקום כמוך | behold I have done according to thy word lo I have given thee a wise and an understanding heart so that there hath been none like thee before thee neither after thee shall any arise like unto thee | ויאמר יהושפט יש אותו דבר-יהוה וירדו אליו מלך ישראל ויהושפט--ומלך אדום | And Jehoshaphat said 'The word of the LORD is with him' So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat and the king of Edom went down to him
text_en: behold, I have done according to thy word: lo, I have given thee a wise and an understanding heart; so that there hath been none like thee before thee, neither after thee shall any arise like unto thee.
text_pisuk: הִנֵּה עָשִׂיתִי, כִּדְבָרֶיךָ; הִנֵּה נָתַתִּי לְךָ, לֵב חָכָם וְנָבוֹן, אֲשֶׁר כָּמוֹךָ לֹא-הָיָה לְפָנֶיךָ, וְאַחֲרֶיךָ לֹא-יָקוּם כָּמוֹךָ. | behold, I have done according to thy word: lo, I have given thee a wise and an understanding heart; so that there hath been none like thee before thee, neither after thee shall any arise like unto thee. | וַיֹּאמֶר, יְהוֹשָׁפָט, יֵשׁ אוֹתוֹ, דְּבַר-יְהוָה; וַיֵּרְדוּ אֵלָיו, מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל וִיהוֹשָׁפָט--וּמֶלֶךְ אֱדוֹם. | And Jehoshaphat said: 'The word of the LORD is with him.' So the king of Israel and Jehoshaphat and the king of Edom went down to him.

text_he: וגם אשר לא-שאלת נתי לך גם-עשר גם-כבוד אשר לא-היה כמוך איש במלכים כל-ימיך | And I have also given thee that which thou hast not asked both riches and honour--so that there hath not been any among the kings like unto thee--all thy days | ויאמר אלישע אל-מלך ישראל מה-לי ולך--לך אל-נביאי אביך ואל-נביאי אמך ויאמר לו מלך ישראל אל כי-קרא יהוה לשלשת המלכים האלה לת אותם ביד-מואב | And Elisha said unto the king of Israel 'What have I to do with thee get thee to the prophets of thy father and to the prophets of thy mother' And the king of Israel said unto him 'Nay for the LORD hath called these three kings together to deliver them into the hand of Moab'
text_en: And I have also given thee that which thou hast not asked, both riches and honour--so that there hath not been any among the kings like unto thee--all thy days.
text_pisuk: וְגַם אֲשֶׁר לֹא-שָׁאַלְתָּ נָתַתִּי לָךְ, גַּם-עֹשֶׁר גַּם-כָּבוֹד: אֲשֶׁר לֹא-הָיָה כָמוֹךָ אִישׁ בַּמְּלָכִים, כָּל-יָמֶיךָ. | And I have also given thee that which thou hast not asked, both riches and honour--so that there hath not been any among the kings like unto thee--all thy days. | וַיֹּאמֶר אֱלִישָׁע אֶל-מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל, מַה-לִּי וָלָךְ--לֵךְ אֶל-נְבִיאֵי אָבִיךָ, וְאֶל-נְבִיאֵי אִמֶּךָ; וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ, מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל, אַל כִּי-קָרָא יְהוָה לִשְׁלֹשֶׁת הַמְּלָכִים הָאֵלֶּה, לָתֵת אוֹתָם בְּיַד-מוֹאָב. | And Elisha said unto the king of Israel: 'What have I to do with thee? get thee to the prophets of thy father, and to the prophets of thy mother.' And the king of Israel said unto him: 'Nay; for the LORD hath called these three kings together to deliver them into the hand of Moab.'

text_he: ואם תלך בדרכי לשמר חקי ומצותי כאשר הלך דויד אביך--והארכתי את-ימיך | And if thou wilt walk in My ways to keep My statutes and My commandments as thy father David did walk then I will lengthen thy days'{S} | ויאמר אלישע חי-יהוה צבאות אשר עמדתי לפניו כי לולי פני יהושפט מלך-יהודה אני נשא--אם-אביט אליך ואם-אראך | And Elisha said 'As the LORD of hosts liveth before whom I stand surely were it not that I regard the presence of Jehoshaphat the king of Judah I would not look toward thee nor see thee
text_en: And if thou wilt walk in My ways, to keep My statutes and My commandments, as thy father David did walk, then I will lengthen thy days.'{S}
text_pisuk: וְאִם תֵּלֵךְ בִּדְרָכַי, לִשְׁמֹר חֻקַּי וּמִצְותַי, כַּאֲשֶׁר הָלַךְ, דָּוִיד אָבִיךָ--וְהַאֲרַכְתִּי, אֶת-יָמֶיךָ. | And if thou wilt walk in My ways, to keep My statutes and My commandments, as thy father David did walk, then I will lengthen thy days.'{S} | וַיֹּאמֶר אֱלִישָׁע, חַי-יְהוָה צְבָאוֹת אֲשֶׁר עָמַדְתִּי לְפָנָיו, כִּי לוּלֵי פְּנֵי יְהוֹשָׁפָט מֶלֶךְ-יְהוּדָה, אֲנִי נֹשֵׂא--אִם-אַבִּיט אֵלֶיךָ, וְאִם-אֶרְאֶךָּ. | And Elisha said: 'As the LORD of hosts liveth, before whom I stand, surely, were it not that I regard the presence of Jehoshaphat the king of Judah, I would not look toward thee, nor see thee.

text_he: ויקץ שלמה והנה חלום ויבוא ירושלם ויעמד לפני ארון ברית-אדני ויעל עלות ויעש שלמים ויעש משתה לכל-עבדיו | And Solomon awoke and behold it was a dream and he came to Jerusalem and stood before the ark of the covenant of the LORD and offered up burnt-offerings and offered peace-offerings and made a feast to all his servants | ועתה קחו-לי מנגן והיה כנגן המנגן ותהי עליו יד-יהוה | But now bring me a minstrel' And it came to pass when the minstrel played that the hand of the LORD came upon him
text_en: And Solomon awoke, and, behold, it was a dream; and he came to Jerusalem, and stood before the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and offered up burnt-offerings, and offered peace-offerings, and made a feast to all his servants.
text_pisuk: וַיִּקַץ שְׁלֹמֹה, וְהִנֵּה חֲלוֹם; וַיָּבוֹא יְרוּשָׁלִַם וַיַּעֲמֹד לִפְנֵי אֲרוֹן בְּרִית-אֲדֹנָי, וַיַּעַל עֹלוֹת וַיַּעַשׂ שְׁלָמִים, וַיַּעַשׂ מִשְׁתֶּה, לְכָל-עֲבָדָיו. | And Solomon awoke, and, behold, it was a dream; and he came to Jerusalem, and stood before the ark of the covenant of the LORD, and offered up burnt-offerings, and offered peace-offerings, and made a feast to all his servants. | וְעַתָּה, קְחוּ-לִי מְנַגֵּן; וְהָיָה כְּנַגֵּן הַמְנַגֵּן, וַתְּהִי עָלָיו יַד-יְהוָה. | But now bring me a minstrel.' And it came to pass, when the minstrel played, that the hand of the LORD came upon him.

text_he: אז תבאנה שתים נשים זנות--אל-המלך ותעמדנה לפניו | Then came there two women that were harlots unto the king and stood before him | ויאמר כה אמר יהוה עשה הנחל הזה גבים גבים | And he said 'Thus saith the LORD Make this valley full of trenches
text_en: Then came there two women, that were harlots, unto the king, and stood before him.
text_pisuk: אָז תָּבֹאנָה, שְׁתַּיִם נָשִׁים זֹנוֹת--אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ; וַתַּעֲמֹדְנָה, לְפָנָיו. | Then came there two women, that were harlots, unto the king, and stood before him. | וַיֹּאמֶר, כֹּה אָמַר יְהוָה: עָשֹׂה הַנַּחַל הַזֶּה, גֵּבִים גֵּבִים. | And he said: 'Thus saith the LORD: Make this valley full of trenches.

text_he: ותאמר האשה האחת בי אדני אני והאשה הזאת ישבת בית אחד ואלד עמה בית | And the one woman said 'Oh my lord I and this woman dwell in one house and I was delivered of a child with her in the house | כי-כה אמר יהוה לא-תראו רוח ולא-תראו גשם והנחל הוא ימלא מים ושתיתם אתם ומקניכם ובהמתכם | For thus saith the LORD Ye shall not see wind neither shall ye see rain yet that valley shall be filled with water and ye shall drink both ye and your cattle and your beasts
text_en: And the one woman said: 'Oh, my lord, I and this woman dwell in one house; and I was delivered of a child with her in the house.
text_pisuk: וַתֹּאמֶר הָאִשָּׁה הָאַחַת, בִּי אֲדֹנִי, אֲנִי וְהָאִשָּׁה הַזֹּאת, יֹשְׁבֹת בְּבַיִת אֶחָד; וָאֵלֵד עִמָּהּ, בַּבָּיִת. | And the one woman said: 'Oh, my lord, I and this woman dwell in one house; and I was delivered of a child with her in the house. | כִּי-כֹה אָמַר יְהוָה, לֹא-תִרְאוּ רוּחַ וְלֹא-תִרְאוּ גֶשֶׁם, וְהַנַּחַל הַהוּא, יִמָּלֵא מָיִם; וּשְׁתִיתֶם אַתֶּם וּמִקְנֵיכֶם, וּבְהֶמְתְּכֶם. | For thus saith the LORD: Ye shall not see wind, neither shall ye see rain, yet that valley shall be filled with water; and ye shall drink, both ye and your cattle and your beasts.

text_he: ויהי ביום השלישי לדתי ותלד גם-האשה הזאת ואנחנו יחדו אין-זר אתנו בית זולתי שתים-אנחנו בית | And it came to pass the third day after I was delivered that this woman was delivered also and we were together there was no stranger with us in the house save we two in the house | ונקל זאת בעיני יהוה ונתן את-מואב בידכם | And this is but a light thing in the sight of the LORD He will also deliver the Moabites into your hand
text_en: And it came to pass the third day after I was delivered, that this woman was delivered also; and we were together; there was no stranger with us in the house, save we two in the house.
text_pisuk: וַיְהִי בַּיּוֹם הַשְּׁלִישִׁי, לְלִדְתִּי, וַתֵּלֶד, גַּם-הָאִשָּׁה הַזֹּאת; וַאֲנַחְנוּ יַחְדָּו, אֵין-זָר אִתָּנוּ בַּבַּיִת, זוּלָתִי שְׁתַּיִם-אֲנַחְנוּ, בַּבָּיִת. | And it came to pass the third day after I was delivered, that this woman was delivered also; and we were together; there was no stranger with us in the house, save we two in the house. | וְנָקַל זֹאת, בְּעֵינֵי יְהוָה; וְנָתַן אֶת-מוֹאָב, בְּיֶדְכֶם. | And this is but a light thing in the sight of the LORD; He will also deliver the Moabites into your hand.

text_he: וימת בן-האשה הזאת לילה אשר שכבה עליו | And this woman's child died in the night because she overlay it | והכיתם כל-עיר מבצר וכל-עיר מבחור וכל-עץ טוב תפילו וכל-מעיני-מים תסתמו וכל החלקה הטובה תכאבו באבנים | And ye shall smite every fortified city and every choice city and shall fell every good tree and stop all fountains of water and mar every good piece of land with stones'
text_en: And this woman's child died in the night; because she overlay it.
text_pisuk: וַיָּמָת בֶּן-הָאִשָּׁה הַזֹּאת, לָיְלָה, אֲשֶׁר שָׁכְבָה, עָלָיו. | And this woman's child died in the night; because she overlay it. | וְהִכִּיתֶם כָּל-עִיר מִבְצָר, וְכָל-עִיר מִבְחוֹר, וְכָל-עֵץ טוֹב תַּפִּילוּ, וְכָל-מַעְיְנֵי-מַיִם תִּסְתֹּמוּ; וְכֹל הַחֶלְקָה הַטּוֹבָה, תַּכְאִבוּ בָּאֲבָנִים. | And ye shall smite every fortified city, and every choice city, and shall fell every good tree, and stop all fountains of water, and mar every good piece of land with stones.'

text_he: ותקם בתוך הלילה ותקח את-בני מאצלי ואמתך ישנה ותשכיבהו בחיקה ואת-בנה המת השכיבה בחיקי | And she arose at midnight and took my son from beside me while thy handmaid slept and laid it in her bosom and laid her dead child in my bosom | ויהי בקר כעלות המנחה והנה-מים באים מדרך אדום ותמלא הארץ את-המים | And it came to pass in the morning about the time of making the offering that behold there came water by the way of Edom and the country was filled with water
text_en: And she arose at midnight, and took my son from beside me, while thy handmaid slept, and laid it in her bosom, and laid her dead child in my bosom.
text_pisuk: וַתָּקָם בְּתוֹךְ הַלַּיְלָה וַתִּקַּח אֶת-בְּנִי מֵאֶצְלִי, וַאֲמָתְךָ יְשֵׁנָה, וַתַּשְׁכִּיבֵהוּ, בְּחֵיקָהּ; וְאֶת-בְּנָהּ הַמֵּת, הִשְׁכִּיבָה בְחֵיקִי. | And she arose at midnight, and took my son from beside me, while thy handmaid slept, and laid it in her bosom, and laid her dead child in my bosom. | וַיְהִי בַבֹּקֶר כַּעֲלוֹת הַמִּנְחָה, וְהִנֵּה-מַיִם בָּאִים מִדֶּרֶךְ אֱדוֹם; וַתִּמָּלֵא הָאָרֶץ, אֶת-הַמָּיִם. | And it came to pass in the morning, about the time of making the offering, that, behold, there came water by the way of Edom, and the country was filled with water.

text_he: ואקם בקר להיניק את-בני והנה-מת ואתבונן אליו בקר והנה לא-היה בני אשר ילדתי | And when I rose in the morning to give my child suck behold it was dead but when I had looked well at it in the morning behold it was not my son whom I did bear' | וכל-מואב שמעו כי-עלו המלכים להלחם בם ויצעקו מכל חגר חגרה ומעלה ויעמדו על-הגבול | Now when all the Moabites heard that the kings were come up to fight against them they gathered themselves together all that were able to put on armour and upward and stood on the border
text_en: And when I rose in the morning to give my child suck, behold, it was dead; but when I had looked well at it in the morning, behold, it was not my son, whom I did bear.'
text_pisuk: וָאָקֻם בַּבֹּקֶר לְהֵינִיק אֶת-בְּנִי, וְהִנֵּה-מֵת; וָאֶתְבּוֹנֵן אֵלָיו בַּבֹּקֶר, וְהִנֵּה לֹא-הָיָה בְנִי אֲשֶׁר יָלָדְתִּי. | And when I rose in the morning to give my child suck, behold, it was dead; but when I had looked well at it in the morning, behold, it was not my son, whom I did bear.' | וְכָל-מוֹאָב, שָׁמְעוּ, כִּי-עָלוּ הַמְּלָכִים, לְהִלָּחֶם בָּם; וַיִּצָּעֲקוּ, מִכֹּל חֹגֵר חֲגֹרָה וָמַעְלָה, וַיַּעַמְדוּ, עַל-הַגְּבוּל. | Now when all the Moabites heard that the kings were come up to fight against them, they gathered themselves together, all that were able to put on armour, and upward, and stood on the border.

text_he: ותאמר האשה האחרת לא כי בני החי ובנך המת וזאת אמרת לא כי בנך המת ובני החי ותדברנה לפני המלך | And the other woman said 'Nay but the living is my son and the dead is thy son' And this said 'No but the dead is thy son and the living is my son' Thus they spoke before the king | וישכימו בקר והשמש זרחה על-המים ויראו מואב מנגד את-המים אדמים כדם | And they rose up early in the morning and the sun shone upon the water and the Moabites saw the water some way off as red as blood
text_en: And the other woman said: 'Nay; but the living is my son, and the dead is thy son.' And this said: 'No; but the dead is thy son, and the living is my son.' Thus they spoke before the king.
text_pisuk: וַתֹּאמֶר הָאִשָּׁה הָאַחֶרֶת לֹא כִי, בְּנִי הַחַי וּבְנֵךְ הַמֵּת, וְזֹאת אֹמֶרֶת לֹא כִי, בְּנֵךְ הַמֵּת וּבְנִי הֶחָי; וַתְּדַבֵּרְנָה, לִפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ. | And the other woman said: 'Nay; but the living is my son, and the dead is thy son.' And this said: 'No; but the dead is thy son, and the living is my son.' Thus they spoke before the king. | וַיַּשְׁכִּימוּ בַבֹּקֶר, וְהַשֶּׁמֶשׁ זָרְחָה עַל-הַמָּיִם; וַיִּרְאוּ מוֹאָב מִנֶּגֶד אֶת-הַמַּיִם, אֲדֻמִּים כַּדָּם. | And they rose up early in the morning, and the sun shone upon the water, and the Moabites saw the water some way off as red as blood;

text_he: ויאמר המלך--זאת אמרת זה-בני החי ובנך המת וזאת אמרת לא כי בנך המת ובני החי | Then said the king 'The one saith This is my son that liveth and thy son is the dead and the other saith Nay but thy son is the dead and my son is the living' | ויאמרו דם זה החרב נחרבו המלכים ויכו איש את-רעהו ועתה לשל מואב | and they said 'This is blood the kings have surely fought together and they have smitten each man his fellow now therefore Moab to the spoil'
text_en: Then said the king: 'The one saith: This is my son that liveth, and thy son is the dead; and the other saith: Nay; but thy son is the dead, and my son is the living.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ--זֹאת אֹמֶרֶת, זֶה-בְּנִי הַחַי וּבְנֵךְ הַמֵּת; וְזֹאת אֹמֶרֶת לֹא כִי, בְּנֵךְ הַמֵּת וּבְנִי הֶחָי. | Then said the king: 'The one saith: This is my son that liveth, and thy son is the dead; and the other saith: Nay; but thy son is the dead, and my son is the living.' | וַיֹּאמְרוּ, דָּם זֶה, הָחֳרֵב נֶחֶרְבוּ הַמְּלָכִים, וַיַּכּוּ אִישׁ אֶת-רֵעֵהוּ; וְעַתָּה לַשָּׁלָל, מוֹאָב. | and they said: 'This is blood: the kings have surely fought together, and they have smitten each man his fellow; now therefore, Moab, to the spoil.'

text_he: ויאמר המלך קחו לי-חרב ויבאו החרב לפני המלך | And the king said 'Fetch me a sword' And they brought a sword before the king | ויבאו אל-מחנה ישראל ויקמו ישראל ויכו את-מואב וינסו מפניהם ויבו- (ויכו-) בה והכות את-מואב | And when they came to the camp of Israel the Israelites rose up and smote the Moabites so that they fled before them And they smote the land even Moab mightily
text_en: And the king said: 'Fetch me a sword.' And they brought a sword before the king.
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ, קְחוּ לִי-חָרֶב; וַיָּבִאוּ הַחֶרֶב, לִפְנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ. | And the king said: 'Fetch me a sword.' And they brought a sword before the king. | וַיָּבֹאוּ, אֶל-מַחֲנֵה יִשְׂרָאֵל, וַיָּקֻמוּ יִשְׂרָאֵל וַיַּכּוּ אֶת-מוֹאָב, וַיָּנֻסוּ מִפְּנֵיהֶם; ויבו- (וַיַּכּוּ-) בָהּ, וְהַכּוֹת אֶת-מוֹאָב. | And when they came to the camp of Israel, the Israelites rose up and smote the Moabites, so that they fled before them. And they smote the land, even Moab, mightily.

text_he: ויאמר המלך גזרו את-הילד החי לשנים ותנו את-החצי לאחת ואת-החצי לאחת | And the king said 'Divide the living child in two and give half to the one and half to the other' | והערים יהרסו וכל-חלקה טובה ישליכו איש-אבנו ומלאוה וכל-מעין-מים יסתמו וכל-עץ-טוב יפילו עד-השאיר אבניה בקיר חרשת ויסבו הקלעים ויכוה | And they beat down the cities and on every good piece of land they cast every man his stone and filled it and they stopped all the fountains of water and felled all the good trees until there was left only Kir-hareseth with the stones of the wall thereof so the slingers encompassed it and smote it
text_en: And the king said: 'Divide the living child in two, and give half to the one, and half to the other.'
text_pisuk: וַיֹּאמֶר הַמֶּלֶךְ, גִּזְרוּ אֶת-הַיֶּלֶד הַחַי לִשְׁנָיִם; וּתְנוּ אֶת-הַחֲצִי לְאַחַת, וְאֶת-הַחֲצִי לְאֶחָת. | And the king said: 'Divide the living child in two, and give half to the one, and half to the other.' | וְהֶעָרִים יַהֲרֹסוּ וְכָל-חֶלְקָה טוֹבָה יַשְׁלִיכוּ אִישׁ-אַבְנוֹ וּמִלְאוּהָ, וְכָל-מַעְיַן-מַיִם יִסְתֹּמוּ וְכָל-עֵץ-טוֹב יַפִּילוּ, עַד-הִשְׁאִיר אֲבָנֶיהָ בַּקִּיר, חֲרָשֶׂת; וַיָּסֹבּוּ הַקַּלָּעִים, וַיַּכּוּהָ. | And they beat down the cities; and on every good piece of land they cast every man his stone, and filled it; and they stopped all the fountains of water, and felled all the good trees; until there was left only Kir-hareseth with the stones of the wall thereof; so the slingers encompassed it, and smote it.

text_he: ותאמר האשה אשר-בנה החי אל-המלך כי-נכמרו רחמיה על-בנה ותאמר בי אדני תנו-לה את-הילוד החי והמת אל-תמיתהו וזאת אמרת גם-לי גם-לך לא יהיה--גזרו | Then spoke the woman whose the living child was unto the king for her heart yearned upon her son and she said 'Oh my lord give her the living child and in no wise slay it' But the other said 'It shall be neither mine nor thine divide it' | וירא מלך מואב כי-חזק מנו המלחמה ויקח אותו שבע-מאות איש שלף חרב להבקיע אל-מלך אדום--ולא יכלו | And when the king of Moab saw that the battle was too sore for him he took with him seven hundred men that drew sword to break through unto the king of Edom but they could not
text_en: Then spoke the woman whose the living child was unto the king, for her heart yearned upon her son, and she said: 'Oh, my lord, give her the living child, and in no wise slay it.' But the other said: 'It shall be neither mine nor thine; divide it.'
text_pisuk: וַתֹּאמֶר הָאִשָּׁה אֲשֶׁר-בְּנָהּ הַחַי אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ, כִּי-נִכְמְרוּ רַחֲמֶיהָ עַל-בְּנָהּ, וַתֹּאמֶר בִּי אֲדֹנִי תְּנוּ-לָהּ אֶת-הַיָּלוּד הַחַי, וְהָמֵת אַל-תְּמִיתֻהוּ; וְזֹאת אֹמֶרֶת, גַּם-לִי גַם-לָךְ לֹא יִהְיֶה--גְּזֹרוּ. | Then spoke the woman whose the living child was unto the king, for her heart yearned upon her son, and she said: 'Oh, my lord, give her the living child, and in no wise slay it.' But the other said: 'It shall be neither mine nor thine; divide it.' | וַיַּרְא מֶלֶךְ מוֹאָב, כִּי-חָזַק מִמֶּנּוּ הַמִּלְחָמָה; וַיִּקַּח אוֹתוֹ שְׁבַע-מֵאוֹת אִישׁ שֹׁלֵף חֶרֶב, לְהַבְקִיעַ אֶל-מֶלֶךְ אֱדוֹם--וְלֹא יָכֹלוּ. | And when the king of Moab saw that the battle was too sore for him, he took with him seven hundred men that drew sword, to break through unto the king of Edom; but they could not.

text_he: ויען המלך ויאמר תנו-לה את-הילוד החי והמת לא תמיתהו היא אמו | Then the king answered and said 'Give her the living child and in no wise slay it she is the mother thereof'{S} | ויקח את-בנו הבכור אשר-ימלך תחתיו ויעלהו עלה על-החמה ויהי קצף-גדול על-ישראל ויסעו מעליו וישבו לארץ | Then he took his eldest son that should have reigned in his stead and offered him for a burnt-offering upon the wall And there came great wrath upon Israel and they departed from him and returned to their own land
text_en: Then the king answered and said: 'Give her the living child, and in no wise slay it: she is the mother thereof.'{S}
text_pisuk: וַיַּעַן הַמֶּלֶךְ וַיֹּאמֶר, תְּנוּ-לָהּ אֶת-הַיָּלוּד הַחַי, וְהָמֵת, לֹא תְמִיתֻהוּ: הִיא, אִמּוֹ. | Then the king answered and said: 'Give her the living child, and in no wise slay it: she is the mother thereof.'{S} | וַיִּקַּח אֶת-בְּנוֹ הַבְּכוֹר אֲשֶׁר-יִמְלֹךְ תַּחְתָּיו, וַיַּעֲלֵהוּ עֹלָה עַל-הַחֹמָה, וַיְהִי קֶצֶף-גָּדוֹל, עַל-יִשְׂרָאֵל; וַיִּסְעוּ, מֵעָלָיו, וַיָּשֻׁבוּ, לָאָרֶץ. | Then he took his eldest son that should have reigned in his stead, and offered him for a burnt-offering upon the wall. And there came great wrath upon Israel; and they departed from him, and returned to their own land.

text_he: וישמעו כל-ישראל את-המשפט אשר שפט המלך ויראו מפני המלך כי ראו כי-חכמת אלהים בקרבו לעשות משפט
text_en: And all Israel heard of the judgment which the king had judged; and they feared the king; for they saw that the wisdom of God was in him, to do justice.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁמְעוּ כָל-יִשְׂרָאֵל, אֶת-הַמִּשְׁפָּט אֲשֶׁר שָׁפַט הַמֶּלֶךְ, וַיִּרְאוּ, מִפְּנֵי הַמֶּלֶךְ: כִּי רָאוּ, כִּי-חָכְמַת אֱלֹהִים בְּקִרְבּוֹ לַעֲשׂוֹת מִשְׁפָּט.

text_he: ויהי המלך שלמה מלך על-כל-ישראל | And king Solomon was king over all Israel{S} | ואשה אחת מנשי בני-הנביאים צעקה אל-אלישע לאמר עבדך אישי מת ואתה ידעת כי עבדך היה ירא את-יהוה והנשה--בא לקחת את-שני ילדי לו לעבדים | Now there cried a certain woman of the wives of the sons of the prophets unto Elisha saying 'Thy servant my husband is dead and thou knowest that thy servant did fear the LORD and the creditor is come to take unto him my two children to be bondmen'
text_en: And king Solomon was king over all Israel.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיְהִי הַמֶּלֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹה, מֶלֶךְ עַל-כָּל-יִשְׂרָאֵל. | And king Solomon was king over all Israel.{S} | וְאִשָּׁה אַחַת מִנְּשֵׁי בְנֵי-הַנְּבִיאִים צָעֲקָה אֶל-אֱלִישָׁע לֵאמֹר, עַבְדְּךָ אִישִׁי מֵת, וְאַתָּה יָדַעְתָּ, כִּי עַבְדְּךָ הָיָה יָרֵא אֶת-יְהוָה; וְהַנֹּשֶׁה--בָּא לָקַחַת אֶת-שְׁנֵי יְלָדַי לוֹ, לַעֲבָדִים. | Now there cried a certain woman of the wives of the sons of the prophets unto Elisha, saying: 'Thy servant my husband is dead; and thou knowest that thy servant did fear the LORD; and the creditor is come to take unto him my two children to be bondmen.'

text_he: ואלה השרים אשר-לו עזריהו בן-צדוק הכהן | And these were the princes whom he had Azariah the son of Zadok the priest{S} | ויאמר אליה אלישע מה אעשה-לך הגידי לי מה-יש-לכי (לך) בית ותאמר אין לשפחתך כל בית כי אם-אסוך שמן | And Elisha said unto her 'What shall I do for thee tell me what hast thou in the house' And she said 'Thy handmaid hath not any thing in the house save a pot of oil'
text_en: And these were the princes whom he had: Azariah the son of Zadok, the priest;{S}
text_pisuk: וְאֵלֶּה הַשָּׂרִים, אֲשֶׁר-לוֹ: עֲזַרְיָהוּ בֶן-צָדוֹק, הַכֹּהֵן. | And these were the princes whom he had: Azariah the son of Zadok, the priest;{S} | וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלֶיהָ אֱלִישָׁע, מָה אֶעֱשֶׂה-לָּךְ, הַגִּידִי לִי, מַה-יֶּשׁ-לכי (לָךְ) בַּבָּיִת; וַתֹּאמֶר, אֵין לְשִׁפְחָתְךָ כֹל בַּבַּיִת, כִּי, אִם-אָסוּךְ שָׁמֶן. | And Elisha said unto her: 'What shall I do for thee? tell me; what hast thou in the house?' And she said: 'Thy handmaid hath not any thing in the house, save a pot of oil.'

text_he: אליחרף ואחיה בני שישא ספרים יהושפט בן-אחילוד המזכיר | Elihoreph and Ahijah the sons of Shisha scribes{S}Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud the recorder{S} | ויאמר לכי שאלי-לך כלים מן-החוץ מאת כל-שכנכי (שכניך)--כלים רקים אל-תמעיטי | Then he said 'Go borrow thee vessels abroad of all thy neighbours even empty vessels borrow not a few
text_en: Elihoreph and Ahijah, the sons of Shisha, scribes;{S}Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud, the recorder;{S}
text_pisuk: אֱלִיחֹרֶף וַאֲחִיָּה בְּנֵי שִׁישָׁא, סֹפְרִים;  יְהוֹשָׁפָט בֶּן-אֲחִילוּד, הַמַּזְכִּיר. | Elihoreph and Ahijah, the sons of Shisha, scribes;{S}Jehoshaphat the son of Ahilud, the recorder;{S} | וַיֹּאמֶר, לְכִי שַׁאֲלִי-לָךְ כֵּלִים מִן-הַחוּץ, מֵאֵת, כָּל-שכנכי (שְׁכֵנָיִךְ)--כֵּלִים רֵקִים, אַל-תַּמְעִיטִי. | Then he said: 'Go, borrow thee vessels abroad of all thy neighbours, even empty vessels; borrow not a few.

text_he: ובניהו בן-יהוידע על-הצבא וצדוק ואביתר כהנים | and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the host{S}and Zadok and Abiathar were priests{S} | ובאת וסגרת הדלת בעדך ובעד-בניך ויצקת על כל-הכלים האלה והמלא תסיעי | And thou shalt go in and shut the door upon thee and upon thy sons and pour out into all those vessels and thou shalt set aside that which is full'
text_en: and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the host;{S}and Zadok and Abiathar were priests;{S}
text_pisuk: וּבְנָיָהוּ בֶן-יְהוֹיָדָע, עַל-הַצָּבָא;  וְצָדוֹק וְאֶבְיָתָר, כֹּהֲנִים. | and Benaiah the son of Jehoiada was over the host;{S}and Zadok and Abiathar were priests;{S} | וּבָאת, וְסָגַרְתְּ הַדֶּלֶת בַּעֲדֵךְ וּבְעַד-בָּנַיִךְ, וְיָצַקְתְּ, עַל כָּל-הַכֵּלִים הָאֵלֶּה; וְהַמָּלֵא, תַּסִּיעִי. | And thou shalt go in, and shut the door upon thee and upon thy sons, and pour out into all those vessels; and thou shalt set aside that which is full.'

text_he: ועזריהו בן-נתן על-הנצבים וזבוד בן-נתן כהן רעה המלך | and Azariah the son of Nathan was over the officers{S}and Zabud the son of Nathan was chief minister and the king's friend{S} | ותלך מאתו ותסגר הדלת בעדה ובעד בניה הם מגישים אליה והיא מיצקת (מוצקת) | So she went from him and shut the door upon her and upon her sons they brought the vessels to her and she poured out
text_en: and Azariah the son of Nathan was over the officers;{S}and Zabud the son of Nathan was chief minister and the king's friend;{S}
text_pisuk: וַעֲזַרְיָהוּ בֶן-נָתָן, עַל-הַנִּצָּבִים;  וְזָבוּד בֶּן-נָתָן כֹּהֵן, רֵעֶה הַמֶּלֶךְ. | and Azariah the son of Nathan was over the officers;{S}and Zabud the son of Nathan was chief minister and the king's friend;{S} | וַתֵּלֶךְ, מֵאִתּוֹ, וַתִּסְגֹּר הַדֶּלֶת, בַּעֲדָהּ וּבְעַד בָּנֶיהָ; הֵם מַגִּישִׁים אֵלֶיהָ, וְהִיא מיצקת (מוֹצָקֶת). | So she went from him, and shut the door upon her and upon her sons; they brought the vessels to her, and she poured out.

text_he: ואחישר על-הבית ואדנירם בן-עבדא על-המס | and Ahishar was over the household{S}and Adoniram the son of Abda was over the levy{S} | ויהי כמלאת הכלים ותאמר אל-בנה הגישה אלי עוד כלי ויאמר אליה אין עוד כלי ויעמד השמן | And it came to pass when the vessels were full that she said unto her son 'Bring me yet a vessel' And he said unto her 'There is not a vessel more' And the oil stayed
text_en: and Ahishar was over the household;{S}and Adoniram the son of Abda was over the levy.{S}
text_pisuk: וַאֲחִישָׁר, עַל-הַבָּיִת;  וַאֲדֹנִירָם בֶּן-עַבְדָּא, עַל-הַמַּס. | and Ahishar was over the household;{S}and Adoniram the son of Abda was over the levy.{S} | וַיְהִי כִּמְלֹאת הַכֵּלִים, וַתֹּאמֶר אֶל-בְּנָהּ הַגִּישָׁה אֵלַי עוֹד כֶּלִי, וַיֹּאמֶר אֵלֶיהָ, אֵין עוֹד כֶּלִי; וַיַּעֲמֹד, הַשָּׁמֶן. | And it came to pass, when the vessels were full, that she said unto her son: 'Bring me yet a vessel.' And he said unto her: 'There is not a vessel more.' And the oil stayed.

text_he: ולשלמה שנים-עשר נצבים על-כל-ישראל וכלכלו את-המלך ואת-ביתו חדש בשנה יהיה על-אחד (האחד) לכלכל | And Solomon had twelve officers over all Israel who provided victuals for the king and his household each man had to make provision for a month in the year{S} | ותבא ותגד לאיש האלהים ויאמר לכי מכרי את-השמן ושלמי את-נשיכי (נשיך) ואת בניכי (ובניך) תחי בנותר | Then she came and told the man of God And he said 'Go sell the oil and pay thy debt and live thou and thy sons of the rest'
text_en: And Solomon had twelve officers over all Israel, who provided victuals for the king and his household: each man had to make provision for a month in the year.{S}
text_pisuk: וְלִשְׁלֹמֹה שְׁנֵים-עָשָׂר נִצָּבִים, עַל-כָּל-יִשְׂרָאֵל, וְכִלְכְּלוּ אֶת-הַמֶּלֶךְ, וְאֶת-בֵּיתוֹ: חֹדֶשׁ בַּשָּׁנָה יִהְיֶה עַל-אחד (הָאֶחָד), לְכַלְכֵּל. | And Solomon had twelve officers over all Israel, who provided victuals for the king and his household: each man had to make provision for a month in the year.{S} | וַתָּבֹא, וַתַּגֵּד לְאִישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים, וַיֹּאמֶר לְכִי מִכְרִי אֶת-הַשֶּׁמֶן, וְשַׁלְּמִי אֶת-נשיכי (נִשְׁיֵךְ); וְאַתְּ בניכי (וּבָנַיִךְ), תִּחְיִי בַּנּוֹתָר. | Then she came and told the man of God. And he said: 'Go, sell the oil, and pay thy debt, and live thou and thy sons of the rest.'

text_he: ואלה שמותם בן-חור בהר אפרים | And these are their names The son of Hur in the hill-country of Ephraim{S} | ויהי היום ויעבר אלישע אל-שונם ושם אשה גדולה ותחזק-בו לאכל-לחם ויהי מדי עברו יסר שמה לאכל-לחם | And it fell on a day that Elisha passed to Shunem where was a great woman and she constrained him to eat bread And so it was that as oft as he passed by he turned in thither to eat bread
text_en: And these are their names: The son of Hur, in the hill-country of Ephraim;{S}
text_pisuk: וְאֵלֶּה שְׁמוֹתָם, בֶּן-חוּר בְּהַר אֶפְרָיִם. | And these are their names: The son of Hur, in the hill-country of Ephraim;{S} | וַיְהִי הַיּוֹם וַיַּעֲבֹר אֱלִישָׁע אֶל-שׁוּנֵם, וְשָׁם אִשָּׁה גְדוֹלָה, וַתַּחֲזֶק-בּוֹ, לֶאֱכָל-לָחֶם; וַיְהִי מִדֵּי עָבְרוֹ, יָסֻר שָׁמָּה לֶאֱכָל-לָחֶם. | And it fell on a day, that Elisha passed to Shunem, where was a great woman; and she constrained him to eat bread. And so it was, that as oft as he passed by, he turned in thither to eat bread.

text_he: בן-דקר במקץ ובשעלבים ובית שמש ואילון בית חנן | the son of Deker in Makaz and in Shaalbim and Beth-shemesh and Elon-beth-hanan{S} | ותאמר אל-אישה הנה-נא ידעתי כי איש אלהים קדוש הוא--עבר עלינו תמיד | And she said unto her husband 'Behold now I perceive that this is a holy man of God that passeth by us continually
text_en: the son of Deker, in Makaz, and in Shaalbim, and Beth-shemesh, and Elon-beth-hanan;{S}
text_pisuk: בֶּן-דֶּקֶר בְּמָקַץ וּבְשַׁעַלְבִים, וּבֵית שָׁמֶשׁ; וְאֵילוֹן, בֵּית חָנָן. | the son of Deker, in Makaz, and in Shaalbim, and Beth-shemesh, and Elon-beth-hanan;{S} | וַתֹּאמֶר, אֶל-אִישָׁהּ, הִנֵּה-נָא יָדַעְתִּי, כִּי אִישׁ אֱלֹהִים קָדוֹשׁ הוּא--עֹבֵר עָלֵינוּ, תָּמִיד. | And she said unto her husband: 'Behold now, I perceive that this is a holy man of God, that passeth by us continually.

text_he: בן-חסד בארבות לו שכה וכל-ארץ חפר | the son of Hesed in Arubboth to him pertained Socoh and all the land of Hepher{S} | נעשה-נא עלית-קיר קטנה ונשים לו שם מטה ושלחן וכסא ומנורה והיה באו אלינו יסור שמה | Let us make I pray thee a little chamber on the roof and let us set for him there a bed and a table and a stool and a candlestick and it shall be when he cometh to us that he shall turn in thither'
text_en: the son of Hesed, in Arubboth; to him pertained Socoh, and all the land of Hepher;{S}
text_pisuk: בֶּן-חֶסֶד, בָּאֲרֻבּוֹת; לוֹ שֹׂכֹה, וְכָל-אֶרֶץ חֵפֶר. | the son of Hesed, in Arubboth; to him pertained Socoh, and all the land of Hepher;{S} | נַעֲשֶׂה-נָּא עֲלִיַּת-קִיר קְטַנָּה, וְנָשִׂים לוֹ שָׁם מִטָּה וְשֻׁלְחָן וְכִסֵּא וּמְנוֹרָה; וְהָיָה בְּבֹאוֹ אֵלֵינוּ, יָסוּר שָׁמָּה. | Let us make, I pray thee, a little chamber on the roof; and let us set for him there a bed, and a table, and a stool, and a candlestick; and it shall be, when he cometh to us, that he shall turn in thither.'

text_he: בן-אבינדב כל-נפת דאר טפת בת-שלמה היתה לו לאשה | the son of Abinadab in all the region of Dor he had Taphath the daughter of Solomon to wife{S} | ויהי היום ויבא שמה ויסר אל-העליה וישכב-שמה | And it fell on a day that he came thither and he turned into the upper chamber and lay there
text_en: the son of Abinadab, in all the region of Dor; he had Taphath the daughter of Solomon to wife;{S}
text_pisuk: בֶּן-אֲבִינָדָב, כָּל-נָפַת דֹּאר; טָפַת, בַּת-שְׁלֹמֹה, הָיְתָה לּוֹ, לְאִשָּׁה. | the son of Abinadab, in all the region of Dor; he had Taphath the daughter of Solomon to wife;{S} | וַיְהִי הַיּוֹם, וַיָּבֹא שָׁמָּה; וַיָּסַר אֶל-הָעֲלִיָּה, וַיִּשְׁכַּב-שָׁמָּה. | And it fell on a day, that he came thither, and he turned into the upper chamber and lay there.

text_he: בענא בן-אחילוד תענך ומגדו וכל-בית שאן אשר אצל צרתנה מתחת ליזרעאל מבית שאן עד אבל מחולה עד מעבר ליקמעם | Baana the son of Ahilud in Taanach and Megiddo and all Beth-shean which is beside Zarethan beneath Jezreel from Beth-shean to Abel-meholah as far as beyond Jokmeam{S} | ויאמר אל-גיחזי נערו קרא לשונמית הזאת ויקרא-לה--ותעמד לפניו | And he said to Gehazi his servant 'Call this Shunammite' And when he had called her she stood before him
text_en: Baana the son of Ahilud, in Taanach and Megiddo, and all Beth-shean which is beside Zarethan, beneath Jezreel, from Beth-shean to Abel-meholah, as far as beyond Jokmeam;{S}
text_pisuk: בַּעֲנָא, בֶּן-אֲחִילוּד, תַּעְנַךְ, וּמְגִדּוֹ; וְכָל-בֵּית שְׁאָן אֲשֶׁר אֵצֶל צָרְתַנָה מִתַּחַת לְיִזְרְעֶאל, מִבֵּית שְׁאָן עַד אָבֵל מְחוֹלָה, עַד, מֵעֵבֶר לְיָקְמְעָם. | Baana the son of Ahilud, in Taanach and Megiddo, and all Beth-shean which is beside Zarethan, beneath Jezreel, from Beth-shean to Abel-meholah, as far as beyond Jokmeam;{S} | וַיֹּאמֶר אֶל-גֵּיחֲזִי נַעֲרוֹ, קְרָא לַשּׁוּנַמִּית הַזֹּאת; וַיִּקְרָא-לָהּ--וַתַּעֲמֹד, לְפָנָיו. | And he said to Gehazi his servant: 'Call this Shunammite.' And when he had called her, she stood before him.

text_he: בן-גבר ברמת גלעד לו חות יאיר בן-מנשה אשר בגלעד לו חבל ארגב אשר בשן--שים ערים גדלות חומה ובריח נחשת | the son of Geber in Ramoth-gilead to him pertained the villages of Jair the son of Manasseh which are in Gilead even to him pertained the region of Argob which is in Bashan threescore great cities with walls and brazen bars{S} | ויאמר לו אמר-נא אליה הנה חרדת אלינו את-כל-החרדה הזאת מה לעשות לך היש לדבר-לך אל-המלך או אל-שר הצבא ותאמר בתוך עמי אנכי ישבת | And he said unto him 'Say now unto her Behold thou hast been careful for us with all this care what is to be done for thee wouldest thou be spoken for to the king or to the captain of the host' And she answered 'I dwell among mine own people'
text_en: the son of Geber, in Ramoth-gilead; to him pertained the villages of Jair the son of Manasseh, which are in Gilead; even to him pertained the region of Argob, which is in Bashan, threescore great cities with walls and brazen bars;{S}
text_pisuk: בֶּן-גֶּבֶר, בְּרָמֹת גִּלְעָד; לוֹ חַוּת יָאִיר בֶּן-מְנַשֶּׁה אֲשֶׁר בַּגִּלְעָד, לוֹ חֶבֶל אַרְגֹּב אֲשֶׁר בַּבָּשָׁן--שִׁשִּׁים עָרִים גְּדֹלוֹת, חוֹמָה וּבְרִיחַ נְחֹשֶׁת. | the son of Geber, in Ramoth-gilead; to him pertained the villages of Jair the son of Manasseh, which are in Gilead; even to him pertained the region of Argob, which is in Bashan, threescore great cities with walls and brazen bars;{S} | וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ, אֱמָר-נָא אֵלֶיהָ הִנֵּה חָרַדְתְּ אֵלֵינוּ אֶת-כָּל-הַחֲרָדָה הַזֹּאת, מֶה לַעֲשׂוֹת לָךְ, הֲיֵשׁ לְדַבֶּר-לָךְ אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ אוֹ אֶל-שַׂר הַצָּבָא; וַתֹּאמֶר, בְּתוֹךְ עַמִּי אָנֹכִי יֹשָׁבֶת. | And he said unto him: 'Say now unto her: Behold, thou hast been careful for us with all this care; what is to be done for thee? wouldest thou be spoken for to the king, or to the captain of the host?' And she answered: 'I dwell among mine own people.'

text_he: אחינדב בן-עדא מחנימה | Ahinadab the son of Iddo in Mahanaim{S} | ויאמר ומה לעשות לה ויאמר גיחזי אבל בן אין-לה--ואישה זקן | And he said 'What then is to be done for her' And Gehazi answered 'Verily she hath no son and her husband is old'
text_en: Ahinadab the son of Iddo, in Mahanaim;{S}
text_pisuk: אֲחִינָדָב בֶּן-עִדֹּא, מַחֲנָיְמָה. | Ahinadab the son of Iddo, in Mahanaim;{S} | וַיֹּאמֶר, וּמֶה לַעֲשׂוֹת לָהּ; וַיֹּאמֶר גֵּיחֲזִי, אֲבָל בֵּן אֵין-לָהּ--וְאִישָׁהּ זָקֵן. | And he said: 'What then is to be done for her?' And Gehazi answered: 'Verily she hath no son, and her husband is old.'

text_he: אחימעץ בנפתלי גם-הוא לקח את-בשמת בת-שלמה--לאשה | Ahimaaz in Naphtali he also took Basemath the daughter of Solomon to wife{S} | ויאמר קרא-לה ויקרא-לה--ותעמד בפתח | And he said 'Call her' And when he had called her she stood in the door
text_en: Ahimaaz, in Naphtali; he also took Basemath the daughter of Solomon to wife;{S}
text_pisuk: אֲחִימַעַץ, בְּנַפְתָּלִי; גַּם-הוּא, לָקַח אֶת-בָּשְׂמַת בַּת-שְׁלֹמֹה--לְאִשָּׁה. | Ahimaaz, in Naphtali; he also took Basemath the daughter of Solomon to wife;{S} | וַיֹּאמֶר, קְרָא-לָהּ; וַיִּקְרָא-לָהּ--וַתַּעֲמֹד, בַּפָּתַח. | And he said: 'Call her.' And when he had called her, she stood in the door.

text_he: בענא בן-חושי באשר ובעלות | Baana the son of Hushai in Asher and Bealoth{S} | ויאמר למועד הזה כעת חיה אתי (את) חבקת בן ותאמר אל-אדני איש האלהים--אל-תכזב בשפחתך | And he said 'At this season when the time cometh round thou shalt embrace a son' And she said 'Nay my lord thou man of God do not lie unto thy handmaid'
text_en: Baana the son of Hushai, in Asher and Bealoth;{S}
text_pisuk: בַּעֲנָא, בֶּן-חוּשָׁי, בְּאָשֵׁר, וּבְעָלוֹת. | Baana the son of Hushai, in Asher and Bealoth;{S} | וַיֹּאמֶר, לַמּוֹעֵד הַזֶּה כָּעֵת חַיָּה, אתי (אַתְּ), חֹבֶקֶת בֵּן; וַתֹּאמֶר, אַל-אֲדֹנִי אִישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים--אַל-תְּכַזֵּב, בְּשִׁפְחָתֶךָ. | And he said: 'At this season, when the time cometh round, thou shalt embrace a son.' And she said: 'Nay, my lord, thou man of God, do not lie unto thy handmaid.'

text_he: יהושפט בן-פרוח בישכר | Jehoshaphat the son of Paruah in Issachar{S} | ותהר האשה ותלד בן למועד הזה כעת חיה אשר-דבר אליה אלישע | And the woman conceived and bore a son at that season when the time came round as Elisha had said unto her
text_en: Jehoshaphat the son of Paruah, in Issachar;{S}
text_pisuk: יְהוֹשָׁפָט בֶּן-פָּרוּחַ, בְּיִשָּׂשכָר. | Jehoshaphat the son of Paruah, in Issachar;{S} | וַתַּהַר הָאִשָּׁה, וַתֵּלֶד בֵּן, לַמּוֹעֵד הַזֶּה כָּעֵת חַיָּה, אֲשֶׁר-דִּבֶּר אֵלֶיהָ אֱלִישָׁע. | And the woman conceived, and bore a son at that season, when the time came round, as Elisha had said unto her.

text_he: שמעי בן-אלא בנימן | Shimei the son of Ela in Benjamin{S} | ויגדל הילד ויהי היום ויצא אל-אביו אל-הקצרים | And when the child was grown it fell on a day that he went out to his father to the reapers
text_en: Shimei the son of Ela, in Benjamin;{S}
text_pisuk: שִׁמְעִי בֶן-אֵלָא, בְּבִנְיָמִן. | Shimei the son of Ela, in Benjamin;{S} | וַיִּגְדַּל, הַיָּלֶד; וַיְהִי הַיּוֹם, וַיֵּצֵא אֶל-אָבִיו אֶל-הַקֹּצְרִים. | And when the child was grown, it fell on a day, that he went out to his father to the reapers.

text_he: גבר בן-ארי בארץ גלעד--ארץ סיחון מלך האמרי ועג מלך הבשן ונציב אחד אשר בארץ | Geber the son of Uri in the land of Gilead the country of Sihon king of the Amorites and of Og king of Bashan and one officer that was in the land | ויאמר אל-אביו ראשי ראשי ויאמר אל-הנער שאהו אל-אמו | And he said unto his father 'My head my head' And he said to his servant 'Carry him to his mother'
text_en: Geber the son of Uri, in the land of Gilead, the country of Sihon king of the Amorites and of Og king of Bashan; and one officer that was in the land.
text_pisuk: גֶּבֶר בֶּן-אֻרִי, בְּאֶרֶץ גִּלְעָד--אֶרֶץ סִיחוֹן מֶלֶךְ הָאֱמֹרִי, וְעֹג מֶלֶךְ הַבָּשָׁן, וּנְצִיב אֶחָד, אֲשֶׁר בָּאָרֶץ. | Geber the son of Uri, in the land of Gilead, the country of Sihon king of the Amorites and of Og king of Bashan; and one officer that was in the land. | וַיֹּאמֶר אֶל-אָבִיו, רֹאשִׁי רֹאשִׁי; וַיֹּאמֶר, אֶל-הַנַּעַר, שָׂאֵהוּ, אֶל-אִמּוֹ. | And he said unto his father: 'My head, my head.' And he said to his servant: 'Carry him to his mother.'

text_he: יהודה וישראל רבים כחול אשר-על-הים לרב אכלים ושתים ושמחים | Judah and Israel were many as the sand which is by the sea in multitude eating and drinking and making merry | וישאהו--ויביאהו אל-אמו וישב על-ברכיה עד-הצהרים וימת | And when he had taken him and brought him to his mother he sat on her knees till noon and then died
text_en: Judah and Israel were many, as the sand which is by the sea in multitude, eating and drinking and making merry.
text_pisuk: יְהוּדָה וְיִשְׂרָאֵל רַבִּים, כַּחוֹל אֲשֶׁר-עַל-הַיָּם לָרֹב, אֹכְלִים וְשֹׁתִים, וּשְׂמֵחִים. | Judah and Israel were many, as the sand which is by the sea in multitude, eating and drinking and making merry. | וַיִּשָּׂאֵהוּ--וַיְבִיאֵהוּ, אֶל-אִמּוֹ; וַיֵּשֶׁב עַל-בִּרְכֶּיהָ עַד-הַצָּהֳרַיִם, וַיָּמֹת. | And when he had taken him, and brought him to his mother, he sat on her knees till noon, and then died.

text_he: ושלמה היה מושל בכל-המלכות--מן-הנהר ארץ פלשתים ועד גבול מצרים מגשים מנחה ועבדים את-שלמה כל-ימי חיו | And Solomon ruled over all the kingdoms from the River unto the land of the Philistines and unto the border of Egypt they brought presents and served Solomon all the days of his life | ונעמן שר-צבא מלך-ארם היה איש גדול לפני אדניו ונשא פנים--כי-בו נתן-יהוה תשועה לארם והאיש היה גבור חיל--מצרע | Now Naaman captain of the host of the king of Aram was a great man with his master and held in esteem because by him the LORD had given victory unto Aram he was also a mighty man of valour but he was a leper
text_en: And Solomon ruled over all the kingdoms from the River unto the land of the Philistines, and unto the border of Egypt; they brought presents, and served Solomon all the days of his life.
text_pisuk: וּשְׁלֹמֹה, הָיָה מוֹשֵׁל בְּכָל-הַמַּמְלָכוֹת--מִן-הַנָּהָר אֶרֶץ פְּלִשְׁתִּים, וְעַד גְּבוּל מִצְרָיִם: מַגִּשִׁים מִנְחָה וְעֹבְדִים אֶת-שְׁלֹמֹה, כָּל-יְמֵי חַיָּיו. | And Solomon ruled over all the kingdoms from the River unto the land of the Philistines, and unto the border of Egypt; they brought presents, and served Solomon all the days of his life. | וְנַעֲמָן שַׂר-צְבָא מֶלֶךְ-אֲרָם הָיָה אִישׁ גָּדוֹל לִפְנֵי אֲדֹנָיו, וּנְשֻׂא פָנִים--כִּי-בוֹ נָתַן-יְהוָה תְּשׁוּעָה, לַאֲרָם; וְהָאִישׁ, הָיָה גִּבּוֹר חַיִל--מְצֹרָע. | Now Naaman, captain of the host of the king of Aram, was a great man with his master, and held in esteem, because by him the LORD had given victory unto Aram; he was also a mighty man of valour, but he was a leper.

text_he: ויהי לחם-שלמה ליום אחד שלשים כר סלת ושים כר קמח | And Solomon's provision for one day was thirty measures of fine flour and threescore measures of meal | וארם יצאו גדודים וישבו מארץ ישראל נערה קטנה ותהי לפני אשת נעמן | And the Arameans had gone out in bands and had brought away captive out of the land of Israel a little maid and she waited on Naaman's wife
text_en: And Solomon's provision for one day was thirty measures of fine flour, and threescore measures of meal;
text_pisuk: וַיְהִי לֶחֶם-שְׁלֹמֹה, לְיוֹם אֶחָד: שְׁלֹשִׁים כֹּר סֹלֶת, וְשִׁשִּׁים כֹּר קָמַח. | And Solomon's provision for one day was thirty measures of fine flour, and threescore measures of meal; | וַאֲרָם יָצְאוּ גְדוּדִים, וַיִּשְׁבּוּ מֵאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל נַעֲרָה קְטַנָּה; וַתְּהִי, לִפְנֵי אֵשֶׁת נַעֲמָן. | And the Arameans had gone out in bands, and had brought away captive out of the land of Israel a little maid; and she waited on Naaman's wife.

text_he: עשרה בקר בראים ועשרים בקר רעי--ומאה צאן לבד מאיל וצבי ויחמור וברברים אבוסים | ten fat oxen and twenty oxen out of the pastures and a hundred sheep beside harts and gazelles and roebucks and fatted fowl | ותאמר אל-גברתה אחלי אדני לפני הנביא אשר בשמרון אז יאסף אתו מצרעתו | And she said unto her mistress 'Would that my lord were with the prophet that is in Samaria then would he recover him of his leprosy'
text_en: ten fat oxen, and twenty oxen out of the pastures, and a hundred sheep, beside harts, and gazelles, and roebucks, and fatted fowl.
text_pisuk: עֲשָׂרָה בָקָר בְּרִאִים, וְעֶשְׂרִים בָּקָר רְעִי--וּמֵאָה צֹאן; לְבַד מֵאַיָּל וּצְבִי, וְיַחְמוּר, וּבַרְבֻּרִים, אֲבוּסִים. | ten fat oxen, and twenty oxen out of the pastures, and a hundred sheep, beside harts, and gazelles, and roebucks, and fatted fowl. | וַתֹּאמֶר, אֶל-גְּבִרְתָּהּ, אַחֲלֵי אֲדֹנִי, לִפְנֵי הַנָּבִיא אֲשֶׁר בְּשֹׁמְרוֹן; אָז יֶאֱסֹף אֹתוֹ, מִצָּרַעְתּוֹ. | And she said unto her mistress: 'Would that my lord were with the prophet that is in Samaria! then would he recover him of his leprosy.'

text_he: כי-הוא רדה בכל-עבר הנהר מתפסח ועד-עזה--בכל-מלכי עבר הנהר ושלום היה לו מכל-עבריו--מסביב | For he had dominion over all the region on this side the River from Tiphsah even to Gaza over all the kings on this side the River and he had peace on all sides round about him | ויבא ויגד לאדניו לאמר כזאת וכזאת דברה הנערה אשר מארץ ישראל | And he went in and told his lord saying 'Thus and thus said the maid that is of the land of Israel'
text_en: For he had dominion over all the region on this side the River, from Tiphsah even to Gaza, over all the kings on this side the River; and he had peace on all sides round about him.
text_pisuk: כִּי-הוּא רֹדֶה בְּכָל-עֵבֶר הַנָּהָר, מִתִּפְסַח וְעַד-עַזָּה--בְּכָל-מַלְכֵי, עֵבֶר הַנָּהָר; וְשָׁלוֹם, הָיָה לוֹ מִכָּל-עֲבָרָיו--מִסָּבִיב. | For he had dominion over all the region on this side the River, from Tiphsah even to Gaza, over all the kings on this side the River; and he had peace on all sides round about him. | וַיָּבֹא, וַיַּגֵּד לַאדֹנָיו לֵאמֹר: כָּזֹאת וְכָזֹאת דִּבְּרָה הַנַּעֲרָה, אֲשֶׁר מֵאֶרֶץ יִשְׂרָאֵל. | And he went in, and told his lord, saying: 'Thus and thus said the maid that is of the land of Israel.'

text_he: וישב יהודה וישראל לבטח איש תחת גפנו ותחת תאנתו מדן ועד-באר שבע--כל ימי שלמה | And Judah and Israel dwelt safely every man under his vine and under his fig-tree from Dan even to Beer-sheba all the days of Solomon{S} | ויאמר מלך-ארם לך-בא ואשלחה ספר אל-מלך ישראל וילך ויקח בידו עשר כרי-כסף ושת אלפים זהב ועשר חליפות בגדים | And the king of Aram said 'Go now and I will send a letter unto the king of Israel' And he departed and took with him ten talents of silver and six thousand pieces of gold and ten changes of raiment
text_en: And Judah and Israel dwelt safely, every man under his vine and under his fig-tree, from Dan even to Beer-sheba, all the days of Solomon.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיֵּשֶׁב יְהוּדָה וְיִשְׂרָאֵל לָבֶטַח, אִישׁ תַּחַת גַּפְנוֹ וְתַחַת תְּאֵנָתוֹ, מִדָּן, וְעַד-בְּאֵר שָׁבַע--כֹּל, יְמֵי שְׁלֹמֹה. | And Judah and Israel dwelt safely, every man under his vine and under his fig-tree, from Dan even to Beer-sheba, all the days of Solomon.{S} | וַיֹּאמֶר מֶלֶךְ-אֲרָם לֶךְ-בֹּא, וְאֶשְׁלְחָה סֵפֶר אֶל-מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל; וַיֵּלֶךְ וַיִּקַּח בְּיָדוֹ עֶשֶׂר כִּכְּרֵי-כֶסֶף, וְשֵׁשֶׁת אֲלָפִים זָהָב, וְעֶשֶׂר, חֲלִיפוֹת בְּגָדִים. | And the king of Aram said: 'Go now, and I will send a letter unto the king of Israel.' And he departed, and took with him ten talents of silver, and six thousand pieces of gold, and ten changes of raiment.

text_he: ויהי לשלמה ארבעים אלף ארות סוסים--למרכבו ושנים-עשר אלף פרשים | And Solomon had forty thousand stalls of horses for his chariots and twelve thousand horsemen | ויבא הספר אל-מלך ישראל לאמר ועתה כבוא הספר הזה אליך הנה שלחתי אליך את-נעמן עבדי ואספתו מצרעתו | And he brought the letter to the king of Israel saying 'And now when this letter is come unto thee behold I have sent Naaman my servant to thee that thou mayest recover him of his leprosy'
text_en: And Solomon had forty thousand stalls of horses for his chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen.
text_pisuk: וַיְהִי לִשְׁלֹמֹה, אַרְבָּעִים אֶלֶף אֻרְות סוּסִים--לְמֶרְכָּבוֹ; וּשְׁנֵים-עָשָׂר אֶלֶף, פָּרָשִׁים. | And Solomon had forty thousand stalls of horses for his chariots, and twelve thousand horsemen. | וַיָּבֵא הַסֵּפֶר, אֶל-מֶלֶךְ יִשְׂרָאֵל לֵאמֹר: וְעַתָּה, כְּבוֹא הַסֵּפֶר הַזֶּה אֵלֶיךָ, הִנֵּה שָׁלַחְתִּי אֵלֶיךָ אֶת-נַעֲמָן עַבְדִּי, וַאֲסַפְתּוֹ מִצָּרַעְתּוֹ. | And he brought the letter to the king of Israel, saying: 'And now when this letter is come unto thee, behold, I have sent Naaman my servant to thee, that thou mayest recover him of his leprosy.'

text_he: וכלכלו הנצבים האלה את-המלך שלמה ואת כל-הקרב אל-שלחן המלך-שלמה--איש חדשו לא יעדרו דבר | And those officers provided victual for king Solomon and for all that came unto king Solomon's table every man in his month they let nothing be lacking | ויהי כקרא מלך-ישראל את-הספר ויקרע בגדיו ויאמר האלהים אני להמית ולהחיות כי-זה שלח אלי לאסף איש מצרעתו כי אך-דעו-נא וראו כי-מתאנה הוא לי | And it came to pass when the king of Israel had read the letter that he rent his clothes and said 'Am I God to kill and to make alive that this man doth send unto me to recover a man of his leprosy but consider I pray you and see how he seeketh an occasion against me'
text_en: And those officers provided victual for king Solomon, and for all that came unto king Solomon's table, every man in his month; they let nothing be lacking.
text_pisuk: וְכִלְכְּלוּ הַנִּצָּבִים הָאֵלֶּה אֶת-הַמֶּלֶךְ שְׁלֹמֹה, וְאֵת כָּל-הַקָּרֵב אֶל-שֻׁלְחַן הַמֶּלֶךְ-שְׁלֹמֹה--אִישׁ חָדְשׁוֹ: לֹא יְעַדְּרוּ, דָּבָר. | And those officers provided victual for king Solomon, and for all that came unto king Solomon's table, every man in his month; they let nothing be lacking. | וַיְהִי כִּקְרֹא מֶלֶךְ-יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת-הַסֵּפֶר וַיִּקְרַע בְּגָדָיו, וַיֹּאמֶר הַאֱלֹהִים אָנִי לְהָמִית וּלְהַחֲיוֹת, כִּי-זֶה שֹׁלֵחַ אֵלַי, לֶאֱסֹף אִישׁ מִצָּרַעְתּוֹ: כִּי אַךְ-דְּעוּ-נָא וּרְאוּ, כִּי-מִתְאַנֶּה הוּא לִי. | And it came to pass, when the king of Israel had read the letter, that he rent his clothes, and said: 'Am I God, to kill and to make alive, that this man doth send unto me to recover a man of his leprosy? but consider, I pray you, and see how he seeketh an occasion against me.'

text_he: והשערים והתבן לסוסים ולרכש--יבאו אל-המקום אשר יהיה-שם איש כמשפטו | Barley also and straw for the horses and swift steeds brought they unto the place where it should be every man according to his charge{S} | ויהי כשמע אלישע איש-האלהים כי-קרע מלך-ישראל את-בגדיו וישלח אל-המלך לאמר למה קרעת בגדיך יבא-נא אלי--וידע כי יש נביא בישראל | And it was so when Elisha the man of God heard that the king of Israel had rent his clothes that he sent to the king saying 'Wherefore hast thou rent thy clothes let him come now to me and he shall know that there is a prophet in Israel'
text_en: Barley also and straw for the horses and swift steeds brought they unto the place where it should be, every man according to his charge.{S}
text_pisuk: וְהַשְּׂעֹרִים וְהַתֶּבֶן, לַסּוּסִים וְלָרָכֶשׁ--יָבִאוּ, אֶל-הַמָּקוֹם אֲשֶׁר יִהְיֶה-שָּׁם, אִישׁ, כְּמִשְׁפָּטוֹ. | Barley also and straw for the horses and swift steeds brought they unto the place where it should be, every man according to his charge.{S} | וַיְהִי כִּשְׁמֹעַ אֱלִישָׁע אִישׁ-הָאֱלֹהִים, כִּי-קָרַע מֶלֶךְ-יִשְׂרָאֵל אֶת-בְּגָדָיו, וַיִּשְׁלַח אֶל-הַמֶּלֶךְ לֵאמֹר, לָמָּה קָרַעְתָּ בְּגָדֶיךָ; יָבֹא-נָא אֵלַי--וְיֵדַע, כִּי יֵשׁ נָבִיא בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל. | And it was so, when Elisha the man of God heard that the king of Israel had rent his clothes, that he sent to the king, saying: 'Wherefore hast thou rent thy clothes? let him come now to me, and he shall know that there is a prophet in Israel.'

text_he: ויתן אלהים חכמה לשלמה ותבונה הרבה מאד ורחב לב--כחול אשר על-שפת הים | And God gave Solomon wisdom and understanding exceeding much and largeness of heart even as the sand that is on the sea-shore | ויבא נעמן בסוסו וברכבו ויעמד פתח-הבית לאלישע | So Naaman came with his horses and with his chariots and stood at the door of the house of Elisha
text_en: And God gave Solomon wisdom and understanding exceeding much, and largeness of heart, even as the sand that is on the sea-shore.
text_pisuk: וַיִּתֵּן אֱלֹהִים חָכְמָה לִשְׁלֹמֹה וּתְבוּנָה, הַרְבֵּה מְאֹד; וְרֹחַב לֵב--כַּחוֹל, אֲשֶׁר עַל-שְׂפַת הַיָּם. | And God gave Solomon wisdom and understanding exceeding much, and largeness of heart, even as the sand that is on the sea-shore. | וַיָּבֹא נַעֲמָן, בְּסוּסָו וּבְרִכְבּוֹ; וַיַּעֲמֹד פֶּתַח-הַבַּיִת, לֶאֱלִישָׁע. | So Naaman came with his horses and with his chariots, and stood at the door of the house of Elisha.

text_he: ותרב חכמת שלמה מחכמת כל-בני-קדם ומכל חכמת מצרים | And Solomon's wisdom excelled the wisdom of all the children of the east and all the wisdom of Egypt | וישלח אליו אלישע מלאך לאמר הלוך ורחצת שבע-פעמים בירדן וישב בשרך לך וטהר | And Elisha sent a messenger unto him saying 'Go and wash in the Jordan seven times and thy flesh shall come back to thee and thou shalt be clean'
text_en: And Solomon's wisdom excelled the wisdom of all the children of the east, and all the wisdom of Egypt.
text_pisuk: וַתֵּרֶב חָכְמַת שְׁלֹמֹה, מֵחָכְמַת כָּל-בְּנֵי-קֶדֶם, וּמִכֹּל, חָכְמַת מִצְרָיִם. | And Solomon's wisdom excelled the wisdom of all the children of the east, and all the wisdom of Egypt. | וַיִּשְׁלַח אֵלָיו אֱלִישָׁע, מַלְאָךְ לֵאמֹר: הָלוֹךְ, וְרָחַצְתָּ שֶׁבַע-פְּעָמִים בַּיַּרְדֵּן, וְיָשֹׁב בְּשָׂרְךָ לְךָ, וּטְהָר. | And Elisha sent a messenger unto him, saying: 'Go and wash in the Jordan seven times, and thy flesh shall come back to thee, and thou shalt be clean.'

text_he: ויחכם מכל-האדם מאיתן האזרחי והימן וכלכל ודרדע בני מחול ויהי-שמו בכל-הגוים סביב | For he was wiser than all men than Ethan the Ezrahite and Heman and Calcol and Darda the sons of Mahol and his fame was in all the nations round about | ויקצף נעמן וילך ויאמר הנה אמרתי אלי יצא יצוא ועמד וקרא בשם-יהוה אלהיו והניף ידו אל-המקום ואסף המצרע | But Naaman was wroth and went away and said 'Behold I thought He will surely come out to me and stand and call on the name of the LORD his God and wave his hand over the place and recover the leper
text_en: For he was wiser than all men: than Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman, and Calcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol; and his fame was in all the nations round about.
text_pisuk: וַיֶּחְכַּם, מִכָּל-הָאָדָם, מֵאֵיתָן הָאֶזְרָחִי וְהֵימָן וְכַלְכֹּל וְדַרְדַּע, בְּנֵי מָחוֹל; וַיְהִי-שְׁמוֹ בְכָל-הַגּוֹיִם, סָבִיב. | For he was wiser than all men: than Ethan the Ezrahite, and Heman, and Calcol, and Darda, the sons of Mahol; and his fame was in all the nations round about. | וַיִּקְצֹף נַעֲמָן, וַיֵּלַךְ; וַיֹּאמֶר הִנֵּה אָמַרְתִּי אֵלַי יֵצֵא יָצוֹא, וְעָמַד וְקָרָא בְּשֵׁם-יְהוָה אֱלֹהָיו, וְהֵנִיף יָדוֹ אֶל-הַמָּקוֹם, וְאָסַף הַמְּצֹרָע. | But Naaman was wroth, and went away, and said: 'Behold, I thought: He will surely come out to me, and stand, and call on the name of the LORD his God, and wave his hand over the place, and recover the leper.

text_he: וידבר שלשת אלפים משל ויהי שירו חמשה ואלף | And he spoke three thousand proverbs and his songs were a thousand and five | הלא טוב אבנה (אמנה) ופרפר נהרות דמשק מכל מימי ישראל--הלא-ארחץ בהם וטהרתי ויפן וילך בחמה | Are not Amanah and Pharpar the rivers of Damascus better than all the waters of Israel may I not wash in them and be clean' So he turned and went away in a rage
text_en: And he spoke three thousand proverbs; and his songs were a thousand and five.
text_pisuk: וַיְדַבֵּר, שְׁלֹשֶׁת אֲלָפִים מָשָׁל; וַיְהִי שִׁירוֹ, חֲמִשָּׁה וָאָלֶף. | And he spoke three thousand proverbs; and his songs were a thousand and five. | הֲלֹא טוֹב אבנה (אֲמָנָה) וּפַרְפַּר נַהֲרוֹת דַּמֶּשֶׂק, מִכֹּל מֵימֵי יִשְׂרָאֵל--הֲלֹא-אֶרְחַץ בָּהֶם, וְטָהָרְתִּי; וַיִּפֶן, וַיֵּלֶךְ בְּחֵמָה. | Are not Amanah and Pharpar, the rivers of Damascus, better than all the waters of Israel? may I not wash in them, and be clean?' So he turned, and went away in a rage.

text_he: וידבר על-העצים מן-הארז אשר בלבנון ועד האזוב אשר יצא בקיר וידבר על-הבהמה ועל-העוף ועל-הרמש ועל-הדגים | And he spoke of trees from the cedar that is in Lebanon even unto the hyssop that springeth out of the wall he spoke also of beasts and of fowl and of creeping things and of fishes | ויגשו עבדיו וידברו אליו ויאמרו אבי דבר גדול הנביא דבר אליך הלוא תעשה ואף כי-אמר אליך רחץ וטהר | And his servants came near and spoke unto him and said 'My father if the prophet had bid thee do some great thing wouldest thou not have done it how much rather then when he saith to thee Wash and be clean'
text_en: And he spoke of trees, from the cedar that is in Lebanon even unto the hyssop that springeth out of the wall; he spoke also of beasts, and of fowl, and of creeping things, and of fishes.
text_pisuk: וַיְדַבֵּר, עַל-הָעֵצִים, מִן-הָאֶרֶז אֲשֶׁר בַּלְּבָנוֹן, וְעַד הָאֵזוֹב אֲשֶׁר יֹצֵא בַּקִּיר; וַיְדַבֵּר עַל-הַבְּהֵמָה וְעַל-הָעוֹף, וְעַל-הָרֶמֶשׂ וְעַל-הַדָּגִים. | And he spoke of trees, from the cedar that is in Lebanon even unto the hyssop that springeth out of the wall; he spoke also of beasts, and of fowl, and of creeping things, and of fishes. | וַיִּגְּשׁוּ עֲבָדָיו, וַיְדַבְּרוּ אֵלָיו, וַיֹּאמְרוּ אָבִי דָּבָר גָּדוֹל הַנָּבִיא דִּבֶּר אֵלֶיךָ, הֲלוֹא תַעֲשֶׂה; וְאַף כִּי-אָמַר אֵלֶיךָ, רְחַץ וּטְהָר. | And his servants came near, and spoke unto him, and said: 'My father, if the prophet had bid thee do some great thing, wouldest thou not have done it? how much rather then, when he saith to thee: Wash, and be clean?'

text_he: ויבאו מכל-העמים לשמע את חכמת שלמה--מאת כל-מלכי הארץ אשר שמעו את-חכמתו | And there came of all peoples to hear the wisdom of Solomon from all kings of the earth who had heard of his wisdom{S} | וירד ויטבל בירדן שבע פעמים כדבר איש האלהים וישב בשרו כבשר נער קטן--ויטהר | Then went he down and dipped himself seven times in the Jordan according to the saying of the man of God and his flesh came back like unto the flesh of a little child and he was clean
text_en: And there came of all peoples to hear the wisdom of Solomon, from all kings of the earth, who had heard of his wisdom.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיָּבֹאוּ, מִכָּל-הָעַמִּים, לִשְׁמֹעַ, אֵת חָכְמַת שְׁלֹמֹה--מֵאֵת כָּל-מַלְכֵי הָאָרֶץ, אֲשֶׁר שָׁמְעוּ אֶת-חָכְמָתוֹ. | And there came of all peoples to hear the wisdom of Solomon, from all kings of the earth, who had heard of his wisdom.{S} | וַיֵּרֶד, וַיִּטְבֹּל בַּיַּרְדֵּן שֶׁבַע פְּעָמִים, כִּדְבַר, אִישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים; וַיָּשָׁב בְּשָׂרוֹ, כִּבְשַׂר נַעַר קָטֹן--וַיִּטְהָר. | Then went he down, and dipped himself seven times in the Jordan, according to the saying of the man of God; and his flesh came back like unto the flesh of a little child, and he was clean.

text_he: וישלח חירם מלך-צור את-עבדיו אל-שלמה כי שמע כי אתו משחו למלך תחת אביהו כי אהב היה חירם לדוד--כל-הימים | And Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants unto Solomon for he had heard that they had anointed him king in the room of his father for Hiram was ever a lover of David{S} | וישב אל-איש האלהים הוא וכל-מחנהו ויבא ויעמד לפניו ויאמר הנה-נא ידעתי כי אין אלהים בכל-הארץ כי אם-בישראל ועתה קח-נא ברכה מאת עבדך | And he returned to the man of God he and all his company and came and stood before him and he said 'Behold now I know that there is no God in all the earth but in Israel now therefore I pray thee take a present of thy servant'
text_en: And Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants unto Solomon; for he had heard that they had anointed him king in the room of his father; for Hiram was ever a lover of David.{S}
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁלַח חִירָם מֶלֶךְ-צוֹר אֶת-עֲבָדָיו, אֶל-שְׁלֹמֹה, כִּי שָׁמַע, כִּי אֹתוֹ מָשְׁחוּ לְמֶלֶךְ תַּחַת אָבִיהוּ: כִּי אֹהֵב, הָיָה חִירָם לְדָוִד--כָּל-הַיָּמִים. | And Hiram king of Tyre sent his servants unto Solomon; for he had heard that they had anointed him king in the room of his father; for Hiram was ever a lover of David.{S} | וַיָּשָׁב אֶל-אִישׁ הָאֱלֹהִים הוּא וְכָל-מַחֲנֵהוּ, וַיָּבֹא וַיַּעֲמֹד לְפָנָיו, וַיֹּאמֶר הִנֵּה-נָא יָדַעְתִּי כִּי אֵין אֱלֹהִים בְּכָל-הָאָרֶץ, כִּי אִם-בְּיִשְׂרָאֵל; וְעַתָּה קַח-נָא בְרָכָה, מֵאֵת עַבְדֶּךָ. | And he returned to the man of God, he and all his company, and came, and stood before him; and he said: 'Behold now, I know that there is no God in all the earth, but in Israel; now therefore, I pray thee, take a present of thy servant.'

text_he: וישלח שלמה אל-חירם לאמר | And Solomon sent to Hiram saying | ויאמר חי-יהוה אשר-עמדתי לפניו אם-אקח ויפצר-בו לקחת וימאן | But he said 'As the LORD liveth before whom I stand I will receive none' And he urged him to take it but he refused
text_en: And Solomon sent to Hiram, saying:
text_pisuk: וַיִּשְׁלַח שְׁלֹמֹה, אֶל-חִירָם לֵאמֹר. | And Solomon sent to Hiram, saying: | וַיֹּאמֶר, חַי-יְהוָה אֲשֶׁר-עָמַדְתִּי לְפָנָיו אִם-אֶקָּח; וַיִּפְצַר-בּוֹ לָקַחַת, וַיְמָאֵן. | But he said: 'As the LORD liveth, before whom I stand, I will receive none.' And he urged him to take it; but he refused.

text_he: אתה ידעת את-דוד אבי כי לא יכל לבנות בית לשם יהוה אלהיו מפני המלחמה אשר סבהו--עד ת-יהוה אתם תחת כפות רגלו (רגלי) | 'Thou knowest how that David my father could not build a house for the name of the LORD his God for the wars which were about him on every side until the LORD put them under the soles of my feet | ויאמר נעמן ולא יתן-נא לעבדך משא צמד-פרדים אדמה כי לוא-יעשה עוד עבדך עלה וזבח לאלהים אחרים--כי אם-ליהוה | And Naaman said 'If not yet I pray thee let there be given to thy servant two mules' burden of earth for thy servant will henceforth offer neither burnt-offering nor sacrifice unto other gods but unto the LORD
text_en: 'Thou knowest how that David my father could not build a house for the name of the LORD his God for the wars which were about him on every side, until the LORD put them under the soles of my feet.
text_pisuk: אַתָּה יָדַעְתָּ אֶת-דָּוִד אָבִי, כִּי לֹא יָכֹל לִבְנוֹת בַּיִת לְשֵׁם יְהוָה אֱלֹהָיו, מִפְּנֵי הַמִּלְחָמָה, אֲשֶׁר סְבָבֻהוּ--עַד תֵּת-יְהוָה אֹתָם, תַּחַת כַּפּוֹת רגלו (רַגְלָי). | 'Thou knowest how that David my father could not build a house for the name of the LORD his God for the wars which were about him on every side, until the LORD put them under the soles of my feet. | וַיֹּאמֶר, נַעֲמָן, וָלֹא, יֻתַּן-נָא לְעַבְדְּךָ מַשָּׂא צֶמֶד-פְּרָדִים אֲדָמָה: כִּי לוֹא-יַעֲשֶׂה עוֹד עַבְדְּךָ עֹלָה וָזֶבַח, לֵאלֹהִים אֲחֵרִים--כִּי, אִם-לַיהוָה. | And Naaman said: 'If not, yet I pray thee let there be given to thy servant two mules' burden of earth; for thy servant will henceforth offer neither burnt-offering nor sacrifice unto other gods, but unto the LORD.

text_he: ועתה הניח יהוה אלהי לי מסביב אין שטן ואין פגע רע | But now the LORD my God hath given me rest on every side there is neither adversary nor evil occurrence | לדבר הזה יסלח יהוה לעבדך--בוא אדני בית-רמון להשתחות שמה והוא נשען על-ידי והשתחויתי בית רמן בהשתחויתי בית רמן יסלח-נא ( ) יהוה לעבדך בדבר הזה | In this thing the LORD pardon thy servant when my master goeth into the house of Rimmon to worship there and he leaneth on my hand and I prostrate myself in the house of Rimmon when I prostrate myself in the house of Rimmon the LORD pardon thy servant in this thing'
text_en: But now the LORD my God hath given me rest on every side; there is neither adversary, nor evil occurrence.
text_pisuk: וְעַתָּה, הֵנִיחַ יְהוָה אֱלֹהַי לִי מִסָּבִיב: אֵין שָׂטָן, וְאֵין פֶּגַע רָע. | But now the LORD my God hath given me rest on every side; there is neither adversary, nor evil occurrence. | לַדָּבָר הַזֶּה, יִסְלַח יְהוָה לְעַבְדֶּךָ--בְּבוֹא אֲדֹנִי בֵית-רִמּוֹן לְהִשְׁתַּחֲות שָׁמָּה וְהוּא נִשְׁעָן עַל-יָדִי, וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוֵיתִי בֵּית רִמֹּן, בְּהִשְׁתַּחֲוָיָתִי בֵּית רִמֹּן, יִסְלַח-נא ( ) יְהוָה לְעַבְדְּךָ בַּדָּבָר הַזֶּה. | In this thing the LORD pardon thy servant: when my master goeth into the house of Rimmon to worship there, and he leaneth on my hand, and I prostrate myself in the house of Rimmon, when I prostrate myself in the house of Rimmon, the LORD pardon thy servant in this thing.'

text_he: והני אמר--לבנות בית לשם יהוה אלהי כאשר דבר יהוה אל-דוד אבי לאמר בנך אשר אתן תחתיך על-כסאך הוא-יבנה הבית לשמי | And behold I purpose to build a house for the name of the LORD my God as the LORD spoke unto David my father saying Thy son whom I will set upon thy throne in thy room he shall build the house for My name | ויאמר לו לך לשלום וילך מאתו כברת-ארץ | And he said unto him 'Go in peace' So he departed from him some way{S}
text_en: And, behold, I purpose to build a house for the name of the LORD my God, as the LORD spoke unto David my father, saying: Thy son, whom I will set upon thy throne in thy room, he shall build the house for My name.
text_pisuk: וְהִנְנִי אֹמֵר--לִבְנוֹת בַּיִת, לְשֵׁם יְהוָה אֱלֹהָי: כַּאֲשֶׁר דִּבֶּר יְהוָה, אֶל-דָּוִד אָבִי לֵאמֹר, בִּנְךָ אֲשֶׁר אֶתֵּן תַּחְתֶּיךָ עַל-כִּסְאֶךָ, הוּא-יִבְנֶה הַבַּיִת לִשְׁמִי. | And, behold, I purpose to build a house for the name of the LORD my God, as the LORD spoke unto David my father, saying: Thy son, whom I will set upon thy throne in thy room, he shall build the house for My name. | וַיֹּאמֶר לוֹ, לֵךְ לְשָׁלוֹם; וַיֵּלֶךְ מֵאִתּוֹ, כִּבְרַת-אָרֶץ. | And he said unto him: 'Go in peace.' So he departed from him some way.{S}

text_he: ועתה צוה ויכרתו-לי ארזים מן-הלבנון ועבדי יהיו עם-עבדיך ושכר עבדיך אתן לך כל אשר תאמר כי אתה ידעת כי אין בנו איש ידע לכרת-עצים--כצדנים | Now therefore command thou that they hew me cedar-trees out of Lebanon and my servants shall be with thy servants and I will give thee hire for thy servants according to all that thou shalt say for thou knowest that there is not among us any that hath skill to hew timber like unto the Zidonians' | ויאמר גיחזי נער אלישע איש-האלהים הנה חשך אדני את-נעמן הארמי הזה מקחת מידו את אשר-הביא חי-יהוה כי-אם-רצתי אחריו ולקחתי מאתו מאומה | But Gehazi the servant of Elisha the man of God said 'Behold my master hath spared this Naaman the Aramean in not receiving at his hands that which he brought as the LORD liveth I will surely run after him and take somewhat of him'
text_en: Now therefore command thou that they hew me cedar-trees out of Lebanon; and my servants shall be with thy servants; and I will give thee hire for thy servants according to all that thou shalt say; for thou knowest that there is not among us any that hath skill to hew timber like unto the Zidonians.'
text_pisuk: וְעַתָּה צַוֵּה וְיִכְרְתוּ-לִי אֲרָזִים מִן-הַלְּבָנוֹן, וַעֲבָדַי יִהְיוּ עִם-עֲבָדֶיךָ, וּשְׂכַר עֲבָדֶיךָ אֶתֵּן לְךָ, כְּכֹל אֲשֶׁר תֹּאמֵר: כִּי אַתָּה יָדַעְתָּ, כִּי אֵין בָּנוּ אִישׁ יֹדֵעַ לִכְרָת-עֵצִים--כַּצִּדֹנִים. | Now therefore command thou that they hew me cedar-trees out of Lebanon; and my servants shall be with thy servants; and I will give thee hire for thy servants according to all that thou shalt say; for thou knowest that there is not among us any that hath skill to hew timber like unto the Zidonians.' | וַיֹּאמֶר גֵּיחֲזִי, נַעַר אֱלִישָׁע אִישׁ-הָאֱלֹהִים, הִנֵּה חָשַׂךְ אֲדֹנִי אֶת-נַעֲמָן הָאֲרַמִּי הַזֶּה, מִקַּחַת מִיָּדוֹ אֵת אֲשֶׁר-הֵבִיא; חַי-יְהוָה כִּי-אִם-רַצְתִּי אַחֲרָיו, וְלָקַחְתִּי מֵאִתּוֹ מְאוּמָה. | But Gehazi, the servant of Elisha the man of God, said: 'Behold, my master hath spared this Naaman the Aramean, in not receiving at his hands that which he brought; as the LORD liveth, I will surely run after him, and take somewhat of him.'
